Type-3, 0.8mm, 10L, Thin PCB, Mid Loss (ML), For LPDDR5/x Memory Down (internal Only - mRVP)

Pcb Type: Type-3

Pcb Thickness: 0.8mm

Pcb Layer Count: 10

Category: Thin PCB

Material: Mid Loss (ML)

Variant: For LPDDR5/x Memory Down (internal Only - mRVP)

Type-3, 0.8mm, 10L, Thin PCB, Mid Loss (ML), For LPDDR5/x Memory Down (internal Only - mRVP)
Routing LayerDescriptionTline TypeDescription MemoryTline Type MemoryThickness (um)EDWDielectric ConstantLoss Tangent
S/MNoneS/MNone1340.031
1BO, PowerMSBO, PowerMS309.6
PPNonePPNone603.40.013
2GNDGND/PowerGNDGND/Power30
CORENoneCORENone503.60.013
3PowerGND/PowerBO, Main RouteSL309.6
PPNonePPNone603.40.013
4GNDGND/PowerGNDGND/Power309.6
CORENoneCORENone503.60.013
5BO, Main Route, PowerGND/PowerBO, Main RouteSL309.6
PPNonePPNone603.40.013
6BO, Main Route, PowerSLGNDGND/Power309.6
CORENoneCORENone503.60.013
7GNDGND/PowerMain Route, PowerSL309.6
PPNonePPNone603.40.013
8BO, Main Route, PowerSLGNDGND/Power309.6
CORENoneCORENone503.60.013
9GNDGND/PowerGNDGND/Power309.6
PPNonePPNone603.40.013
10BO, Main Route, PowerMSGND, PowerGND/Power309.6
S/MNoneS/MNone1340.031
Notes
Note
Dielectric thickness of 60um for pre-peg and 50um for core has been chosen specifically on SL layers to ensure enhanced POR memory speed target of 9600. Stack-up with thicker dielectrics may not be able to meet 9600MT/s speed bin due to higher cross talk co-efficients than those specified in memory Tline spec

M*MS1, 10CNVio31209037575080-0.92-0.20.04
M*SL6, 8CNVio38013037575080-1.030.0020
Type-3, 0.8mm, 10L, Thin PCB, Mid Loss (ML) Tline Spec (Differential) Notes
Note
Routing Notes for CSI CPHY: (1) CPHY must be routed as a trio (2) If the port is supposed to support both CPHY and DPHY, it must be routed following CPHY guidelines (3) CPHY impedance target is 40 ohms single ended and 80 ohms differential (4) All traces in trio must follow same trace width (5) Intra-Pair guidelines must be used for trace to trace spacing in a trio (6) S-ES guidelines must be used for trio to trio in the same port (7) S-Non-ES must be used for port to port or CPHY to other interface
For CNVio3 signal spacing and sequence, Refer the "CNVio Signal Routing Sequence and CLK-to-CLK Spacing Recommendation" Diagram in CNVio3 Section
For Hayden Bridge/Gothic Bridge and Barlow Ridge post retimer channel, expected losses for Microstrip in dB/inch are (i) at 10 Ghz: -1.62 [Typical] - 1.96[Maximum] (ii) at 12.8 Ghz: -2 [Typical] -2.42 [Maximum]

M*DSL3, 4CPU Sideband120125125403644-0.213.223.22
M*DSL3, 4Imaging Clock, SUSCLK120375375403644-0.210.140.14
M*DSL3, 4SPI0 Flash, eSPI120250375403644-0.210.640.14
M*DSL3, 4XTAL, RTC1202001775403644-0.211.210.006
Type-3, 0.8mm, 10L, Thin PCB, Mid Loss (ML) Tline Spec (Single Ended) Notes
Note
Based on Tline Spec (Single Ended) table recommendation, the CLK - Any (um) spacing requirement shall be applicable for; 1) CLK to DATA signals on similar signaling group 2) CLK to DATA signals from other signaling group 3) CLK to CLK signals from other signaling group For CLK to pseudo static signals, the spacing between the CLK to others can be relaxed and used the DATA - Any (um) spacing requirement. Example of pseudo static signal: RESET, ALERT, Chip Select (CS), Request (REQ), INTERRUPT, INIT.

DDR5

Interface: DDR5

Notes

Type-3, 0.8mm, 10L, Thin PCB, Mid Loss (ML) DDR5 Notes
Note
RCOMP to other nets spacing requirement is minimum 400um.
DDR to Non-DDR nets spacing requirement is minimum 500um.
DRAM RESET to be routed with 40 ohm impedance on L1,L3 & L5 and the spacing requirement is minimum 250um from other nets.
Route RCOMP with 75um TW (MR) in Layer 1,10. GND shield to any high speed IO with VSS trace/ strip. GND reference required.

Trace Width

Topology: MD 1Rx16

Channel: CH-0, CH-1, CH-2, CH-3

LPDDR5/x

Interface: LPDDR5/x

Notes

Type-3, 0.8mm, 10L, Thin PCB, Mid Loss (ML) LPDDR5/x Notes
Note
RCOMP to other nets spacing requirement is minimum 400um.
DDR to Non-DDR nets spacing requirement is minimum 500um.
DRAM RESET to be routed with 40ohms impedance on Layer1,Layer 3 and Layer 5 and distance to other nets (spacing requirement) is minimum 250um
Route RCOMP with 75um TW (MR) in Layer 1,10. GND shield to any high speed IO with VSS trace/ strip. GND reference required.

Notes
Note
Dielectric thickness of 64um has been chosen specifically on SL layers to ensure POR memory speeds are met. Customers following thicker dielectrics will need to ensure cross talk co-efficients are equal to or less than those specified in memory Tline spec

M*DSL4DP TCP, HDMI TCP, Type-C TBT+USB+DP, Type-C USB, Type-C USB+DP, eDP1408537550080-0.660.320.11
M*DSL4Differential Clock (Gen3 and below support)1408537537580-0.660.320.32
M*DSL4Differential Clock (Gen4 and Gen5 support)1408554076080-0.660.080.015
M*DSL4PCIe Gen 41408537537580-0.660.320.32
M*DSL4PCIe Gen 51408560076080-0.660.0480.013
M*DSL4USB3.21408545050080-0.660.170.11
B*DSL4PCIe Gen 5888850050095-0.7020.1190.119
M*MS1, 8CNVio31159537575080-0.91-0.220.04
M*SL3, 6CNVio38014037575080-0.940.0060
B*MS1, 8CSI CPHY81888837591-1.0020.5190.176
B*SL3, 6CSI CPHY75888830078-0.9161.7130.027
M*SL3, 6CSI CPHY8517017050078-0.8860.3410.001
Type-3, 0.8mm, 8L, Mainstream, Mid Loss (ML) Tline Spec (Differential) Notes
Note
For CNVio3 signal spacing and sequence, Refer the "CNVio Signal Routing Sequence and CLK-to-CLK Spacing Recommendation" Diagram in CNVio3 Section
For Hayden Bridge/Gothic Bridge and Barlow Ridge post retimer channel, expected losses for Microstrip in dB/inch are (i) at 10 Ghz: -1.7 [Typical] -2.06 [Maximum] (ii) at 12.8 Ghz: -2.1[Typical] -2.56 [Maximum]
Routing Notes for CSI CPHY: (1) CPHY must be routed as a trio (2) If the port is supposed to support both CPHY and DPHY, it must be routed following CPHY guidelines (3) CPHY impedance target is 40 ohms single ended and 80 ohms differential (4) All traces in trio must follow same trace width (5) Intra-Pair guidelines must be used for trace to trace spacing in a trio (6) S-ES guidelines must be used for trio to trio in the same port (7) S-Non-ES must be used for port to port or CPHY to other interface

M*DSL4CPU Sideband235125125403644-0.155.845.84
M*DSL4Imaging Clock, SUSCLK235375375403644-0.150.690.69
M*DSL4SPI0 Flash, eSPI235250375403644-0.151.980.69
M*DSL4XTAL, RTC2352001775403644-0.153.040.002
Type-3, 0.8mm, 8L, Mainstream, Mid Loss (ML) Tline Spec (Single Ended) Notes
Note
Based on Tline Spec (Single Ended) table recommendation, the CLK - Any (um) spacing requirement shall be applicable for; 1) CLK to DATA signals on similar signaling group 2) CLK to DATA signals from other signaling group 3) CLK to CLK signals from other signaling group For CLK to pseudo static signals, the spacing between the CLK to others can be relaxed and used the DATA - Any (um) spacing requirement. Example of pseudo static signal: RESET, ALERT, Chip Select (CS), Request (REQ), INTERRUPT, INIT.

DDR5

Interface: DDR5

Notes

Type-3, 0.8mm, 8L, Mainstream, Mid Loss (ML) DDR5 Notes
Note
RCOMP to other nets spacing requirement is minimum 400um.
DDR to Non-DDR nets spacing requirement is minimum 500um.
DRAM RESET to be routed with 40 ohm impedance on L3 & L7 and the spacing requirement is minimum 250um from other nets.
Route RCOMP with 75um TW (MR) in Layer 1,8. GND shield to any high speed IO with VSS trace/ strip. GND reference required.

LPDDR5/x

Interface: LPDDR5/x

Notes

Type-3, 0.8mm, 8L, Mainstream, Mid Loss (ML) LPDDR5/x Notes
Note
RCOMP to other nets spacing requirement is minimum 400um.
DDR to Non-DDR nets spacing requirement is minimum 500um.
DRAM RESET to be routed with 40ohms impedance on Layer1,Layer 3 and Layer 5 and distance to other nets (spacing requirement) is minimum 250um
Route RCOMP with 75um TW (MR) in Layer 1,8. GND shield to any high speed IO with VSS trace/ strip. GND reference required.

Pcb Layer Count: 10

Category: Mainstream

Material: Premium Mid Loss (PML)

Notes
Note
Dielectric thickness of 64um has been chosen specifically on SL layers to ensure POR memory speeds are met. Customers following thicker dielectrics will need to ensure cross talk co-efficients are equal to or less than those specified in memory Tline spec

M*SL6, 8CSI CPHY8217017050080-0.80.3510.001
B*MS1, 10CSI CPHY81888837591-0.950.6920.181
B*SL6, 8CSI CPHY75888830078-0.831.730.03
M*MS1, 10CNVio31209037575080-0.860.20.04
M*SL6, 8CNVio38013037575080-0.860.0060
Type-3, 0.9mm, 10L, Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML) Tline Spec (Differential) Notes
Note
Routing Notes for CSI CPHY: (1) CPHY must be routed as a trio (2) If the port is supposed to support both CPHY and DPHY, it must be routed following CPHY guidelines (3) CPHY impedance target is 40 ohms single ended and 80 ohms differential (4) All traces in trio must follow same trace width (5) Intra-Pair guidelines must be used for trace to trace spacing in a trio (6) S-ES guidelines must be used for trio to trio in the same port (7) S-Non-ES must be used for port to port or CPHY to other interface
For CNVio3 signal spacing and sequence, Refer the "CNVio Signal Routing Sequence and CLK-to-CLK Spacing Recommendation" Diagram in CNVio3 Section
For Hayden Bridge/Gothic Bridge and Barlow Ridge post retimer channel, expected losses for Microstrip in dB/inch are (i) at 10 Ghz: -1.62 [Typical] - 1.96[Maximum] (ii) at 12.8 Ghz: -2 [Typical] -2.42 [Maximum]

M*DSL3, 4CNVi BRI and RGI120250250403644-0.210.640.64
M*DSL3, 4CPU Sideband120125125403644-0.213.223.22
M*DSL3, 4Imaging Clock, SUSCLK120375375403644-0.210.140.14
M*DSL3, 4SPI0 Flash, eSPI120250375403644-0.210.640.14
M*DSL3, 4XTAL, RTC1202001775403644-0.211.210.006
Type-3, 0.9mm, 10L, Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML) Tline Spec (Single Ended) Notes
Note
Based on Tline Spec (Single Ended) table recommendation, the CLK - Any (um) spacing requirement shall be applicable for; 1) CLK to DATA signals on similar signaling group 2) CLK to DATA signals from other signaling group 3) CLK to CLK signals from other signaling group For CLK to pseudo static signals, the spacing between the CLK to others can be relaxed and used the DATA - Any (um) spacing requirement. Example of pseudo static signal: RESET, ALERT, Chip Select (CS), Request (REQ), INTERRUPT, INIT.

DDR5

Interface: DDR5

Notes

Type-3, 0.9mm, 10L, Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML) DDR5 Notes
Note
RCOMP to other nets spacing requirement is minimum 400um.
DDR to Non-DDR nets spacing requirement is minimum 500um.
DRAM RESET to be routed with 40 ohm impedance on L1,L3 & L5 and the spacing requirement is minimum 250um from other nets.
Route RCOMP with 75um TW (MR) in Layer 1,10. GND shield to any high speed IO with VSS trace/ strip. GND reference required.

LPDDR5/x

Interface: LPDDR5/x

Notes

Type-3, 0.9mm, 10L, Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML) LPDDR5/x Notes
Note
RCOMP to other nets spacing requirement is minimum 400um.
DDR to Non-DDR nets spacing requirement is minimum 500um.
DRAM RESET to be routed with 40ohms impedance on Layer1,Layer 3 and Layer 5 and distance to other nets (spacing requirement) is minimum 250um
Route RCOMP with 75um TW (MR) in Layer 1,10. GND shield to any high speed IO with VSS trace/ strip. GND reference required.

M*SL6CNVio38012037575080-0.840.010
Type-4 2-x-2+, 0.8mm, 10L, Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML) Tline Spec (Differential) Notes
Note
Routing Notes for CSI CPHY: (1) CPHY must be routed as a trio (2) If the port is supposed to support both CPHY and DPHY, it must be routed following CPHY guidelines (3) CPHY impedance target is 40 ohms single ended and 80 ohms differential (4) All traces in trio must follow same trace width (5) Intra-Pair guidelines must be used for trace to trace spacing in a trio (6) S-ES guidelines must be used for trio to trio in the same port (7) S-Non-ES must be used for port to port or CPHY to other interface
For CNVio3 signal spacing and sequence, Refer the "CNVio Signal Routing Sequence and CLK-to-CLK Spacing Recommendation" Diagram in CNVio3 Section
For Hayden Bridge/Gothic Bridge and Barlow Ridge post retimer channel, expected losses for Microstrip in dB/inch are (i) at 10 Ghz: -1.67 [Typical] -2 [Maximum] (ii) at 12.8 Ghz: -2.05 [Typical] -2.46 [Maximum]
For Hayden Bridge/Gothic Bridge and Barlow Ridge post retimer channel, expected losses for L3/L8 Stripline in dB/inch are (i) at 10 Ghz: -1.54 [Typical] -1.86 [Maximum] (ii) at 12.8 Ghz: -1.87 [Typical] -2.22 [Maximum]

Type-4 2-x-2+, 0.8mm, 10L, Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML) Tline Spec (Single Ended) Notes
Note
Based on Tline Spec (Single Ended) table recommendation, the CLK - Any (um) spacing requirement shall be applicable for; 1) CLK to DATA signals on similar signaling group 2) CLK to DATA signals from other signaling group 3) CLK to CLK signals from other signaling group For CLK to pseudo static signals, the spacing between the CLK to others can be relaxed and used the DATA - Any (um) spacing requirement. Example of pseudo static signal: RESET, ALERT, Chip Select (CS), Request (REQ), INTERRUPT, INIT.

LPDDR5/x

Interface: LPDDR5/x

Notes

Type-4 2-x-2+, 0.8mm, 10L, Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML) LPDDR5/x Notes
Note
RCOMP to other nets spacing requirement is minimum 400um.
DDR to Non-DDR nets spacing requirement is minimum 500um.
DRAM RESET to be routed with 40 ohm impedance on L2, L4 & L10 and the spacing requirement is minimum 250um from other nets.
Route RCOMP with 75um TW (MR) in Layer 1,10. GND shield to any high speed IO with VSS trace/ strip. GND reference required.

CNVio2

CNVio2 General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Length matching between P and N within a diff. pairWithin same layer mismatch: 0.254 mm Total length mismatch: 0.381 mm
Length matching between Data and CLK lanes< 1.27 mm
Impedance of differential channelFor a differential channel transmission line impedance of 80 - 85 Ω.
Reference plane(1) Continuous GND is recommended. (2) If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). IO power rails with less than 5A max current can be considered for dual reference implementation. (3) If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt), but stitching caps are required over each plane split within 6 mm of a signal running across the plane split.
Voiding recommendation for mainstream stackupIt is recommended to void reference plane for all component pads, for example AC caps as well as connector pads to optimize the impedance matching in the channel.
Discrete component part size for mainstream stackupIt is recommended to use 0402 or smaller component sizes.
Max via stub length< 900 um
Recommendations and considerations for routing near switch mode power supply, routing under inductor, routing under phase node, and routing under DrMOSRefer to Technical White Paper Doc#:  726825
General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Voiding recommendation for mainstream stackupIt is recommended to void reference plane for all component pads, for example AC caps as well as connector pads to optimize the impedance matching in the channel.
Voiding recommendation for thin stackupIt is recommended to void reference plane for all component pads, for example AC caps as well as connector pads to optimize the impedance matching in the channel.
Discrete component part size for mainstream stackupIt is recomended to use 0402 or smaller component sizes.
Discrete component part size for thin stackupIt is required to use 0201 component size.
CNVio2 Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.381
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.254
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)No0
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)Yes1.27

CNVio3

Description: Serial Time Encoded Protocol (STEP) is a non-NRZ, non-PAM signaling architecture, which is referred to as CNVIO3 in product design guidelines. CNVIO3 (STEP) uses pulse width modulation and operates at a lower fundamental frequency than NRZ for similar data rates. It is a DC coupled asynchronous bus having high bandwidth, low power and small exit latency from low power states. The current version of CNVIO3 has a data transfer rate of 12gbps to support the Intel WIFI7 integrated solution. CNVIO3 runs over same traces as CNVIO2 clock lanes (1 Tx clock and 1 Rx Clock). CNVIO3 along with rest of CNVIO2 interface operates as combo solution, allowing customers to use legacy WIFI6 products, or new WIFI7 modules. Reflections and crosstalk are the primary performance limiters and hence CNVIO3 requires a very clean channels.

CNVio Signal Routing Sequence and CLK-to-CLK Spacing Recommendation
CNVio CLK Breakout and Break-in Guideline
Module Down Pad Dimension and Voiding Requirements
M.2 Connector Pad Voiding Recommendation
Void above and below buried vias PTH pads
CNVio3 General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Length matching between P and N within a diff. pairWithin same layer mismatch: 0.178 mm Total length mismatch: 0.127 mm
Single ended equivalent impedance of differential channelFor a differential channel transmission line impedance of 80Ω, the equivalent required single ended transmission line impedance should be 40 Ω.
Voiding recommendation for mainstream stackupIt is recommended to void reference plane for all component pads such as M.2 Connector pads/Module pads to optimize the impedance matching in the channel. Recommended voiding depth: -For M.2 connector pads: >= 230 um to the closest ground reference layer -For module pads: >= 150 um to the closet ground reference layer
Number of vias allowed Max 2 vias.
Max via stub length for Type 3 PTH ViasMax PTH via stub length is 0.215 mm.
Reference planeDual continuous GND is required.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
CNVio signal sequence and CLK-to-CLK-spacingIt is recommended to route CNVio CLK in between the data lanes. When not possible, extra CLK-to-CLK spacing is required.  Refer to “CNVio Signal Routing Sequence and CLK Spacing Guideline.
CNVio CLK BI routing guideCNVio CLK break-in (BI) at the device requires the same impedance as main route. No neckdown into pin field. Refer to “CNVio CLK BI at Device Guideline” for more details.
Module pad dimensionModule pad dimension is 0.4mm x 0.6mm. Refer to the “Module Down Pad Dimension and Voiding Requirements” diagram.
WiFi SpeedFor designs supporting both WiFi6 and WiFi7, the CLK signals must follow the CNVio3 guideline. Data signals also need to follow CNVio3 guideline as much as possible for consistency. CLK and Data of the same direction must be routed on the same layer and length matching requirement between CLK and Data must also be met.
Essential guidelines for routing near switch mode power supply, routing under inductor, routing under phase node, and routing under DrMOSDo not route CNVio3 traces on any layer of the PCB under phase nodes, Inductor and DrMOS.
Differential Via optimizationDifferential Impedance of a via should be centered around the characteristic impedance of the channel (+/- 10ohms tolerance) for Optimum performance.(#777155)
Maximum via stub for Type 4 Buried PTH Via0.085mm
Voiding for Type4 buried PTH viasNeed to provide void above and below buried via's PTH pads. Voids need to be 75um more in radius than pad radius. Void is required as shapes over big pads cause a capacitive dip in impedance which results in lower margins. Please refer to the image provided as a reference.
RCOMP for CNVio3CNV_RCOMP need to connect to external resistor (200ohm 1%) even if design is using CNVio3 and is not using CNVi2 interface.
Signal Name/ListCNV_WR_CLK_DN, CNV_WR_CLK_DP, CNV_WT_CLK_DN, CNV_WT_CLK_DP. Clock signals of CNVio2 interface will be used for CNVio3, data lanes will be silent.
DC ResistanceMax DC resistance for CNVio bus is TBD Ohm. It is recommended to route the differential lines in a layer as thick as possible to achieve minimum DC resistance.
CNVio3 Insertion Loss Specification-8dB @6GHz
CNVio3 Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.127
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.178
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)Yes1.27

Maximum Via stub allowed for Type3 PTH Via215um
M.2 Connector pin 18Pin 18 of the M.2 connector must be grounded on the motherboard side to prevent common mode coupling from the BRI signal onto CNVio3 signals, possibly resulting in functional failure of the CNVio3 bus.
Maximum via stub allowed for Type 4 Buried PTH via85um. Via optimization is needed for higher via stub.

CSI DPHY

CSI DPHY General Guidelines
NoteDetail
DPHY configuration routing recommendation Recommend each DPHY configuration (example: X4) to be routed on the same layer.
CSI_RCOMP200 Ω +/- 1% pull down to VSS. Provide good noise isolation. Platform Rdc < 0.1 Ω, board capacitance <1.5 pF.
Common mode choke (CMC)Need is platform/ sensor specific and should be located near sensor.
Port connectivityIt is recommended that CSI A be one of the used ports if all ports are not used.
Loss numbers1. PCB Loss number assumed: -0.36dB/inch (worst case) at 1.25 GHz 2. FPC cable loss number assumed: -0.316dB/inch (worst case) at 1.25 GHz 3. Cable length guideline is based on FPC cable. FPC cable loss should be within the loss number specified above. If micro-Coax is used, cable length can be longer as micro-Coax loss. Ex. 40 AWG cable has loss: -0.15dB/inch at 1.25 GHz. Please note that Cable loss numbers are general guidelines and actual numbers may be different due to the dimensions, type of material used. (Refer to the individual topologies for total loss numbers). These loss number take precedence over length mentioned in individual topologies below specially while using lower loss cable options like micro coaxial cables.
Reference plane Microstrip: Must be continuous ground Stripline: Ground on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a IO rail power plane with Iccmax < 5A that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground. Dual Stripline: Ground on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a IO rail power plane with Iccmax < 5A that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route.
CSI DPHY Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.125
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.25
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)Yes1

CSI DPHY Main Link Up To 1.0 Gbps Topology Notes
NoteDetail
510 mm cable assemblyRecommend 100 Ω +/- 10% including tolerances. Return loss < -15 dB @ ≤ 1.25 GHz. Crosstalk < -50 dB @ ≤ 1.25 GHz.
Total insertion loss (BO+M1+M2+Mcable)For ≤ 1.0 Gbps: up to -10 dB @1.25 GHz.

NoteDetail

PCIe Gen4 Add-in Card Clock Topology

PCIe Gen4 Add-in Card Clock Topology Diagram
Differential Clock Shielding
PCIe Gen4 Add-in Card Clock Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Signal isolationDifferential SRC Clocks supporting PCIe Gen4 devices require 0.76 mm (30 mils) isolation to adjacent high speed IOs. Isolation to other Differential Clocks, USB2 and low-speed IOs can be maintained at 0.5 mm (20 mils).
Reference planeContinuous ground only.
EMC/ RF noise protection[1] For signal sections routed as microstrip on surface layer, a GND ring/ shield is advised to be added (follow standard GND ring/ shield guidelines for XTAL) with sufficient GND stitching vias for the length of the microstrip trace. [2] GND ring/ shield stitching vias should be placed at regular intervals of 4 - 12 mm. [3] It is advised to route in inner layer as stripline/ dual stripline routing. Limit microstrip routing and follow above shielding guidelines.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement
Tx4Total Channel

Signal Group: Tx

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartEnd
CPUDevice01
BOTrace12
M1Trace23
M2Trace34
M3Trace45
CONNECTORDevice5-1

M1 + M2DSL, MS, SL
M3MS25.4
McardMS76.2Assumes an add-in card of 50.4 to 76.2 mm.

Signal isolationDifferential SRC Clocks supporting PCIe Gen4 devices require 0.76 mm (30 mils) isolation to adjacent high speed IOs. Isolation to other Differential Clocks, USB2 and low-speed IOs can be maintained at 0.5 mm (20 mils).
Reference planeContinuous ground only.
EMC/ RF noise protection[1] For signal sections routed as microstrip on surface layer, a GND ring/ shield is advised to be added (follow standard GND ring/ shield guidelines for XTAL) with sufficient GND stitching vias for the length of the microstrip trace. [2] GND ring/ shield stitching vias should be placed at regular intervals of 4 - 12 mm. [3] It is advised to route in inner layer as stripline/ dual stripline routing. Limit microstrip routing and follow above shielding guidelines.

PCIe Gen5 Add-in Card Clock Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Signal isolationDifferential SRC Clocks supporting PCIe Gen5 devices require 0.76 mm (30 mils) isolation to adjacent high speed IOs. Isolation to other Differential Clocks, USB2 and low-speed IOs can be maintained at 0.5 mm (20 mils).
Reference planeContinuous ground only
EMC/ RF noise protection[1] For signal sections routed as microstrip on surface layer, a GND ring/ shield is advised to be added (follow standard GND ring/ shield guidelines for XTAL) with sufficient GND stitching vias for the length of the microstrip trace. [2] GND ring/ shield stitching vias should be placed at regular intervals of 4 - 12 mm. [3] It is advised to route in inner layer as stripline/ dual stripline routing. Limit microstrip routing and follow above shielding guidelines. [4] GND ring/ shield spacing to signal should be 4x the dielectric height of the stackup or approximately 300 um (whichever is larger). Clock signal spacing to other signals should follow the signal isolation guidelines . [5] GND ring/ shield width should be 2x the dielectric height of the stackup or approximately 140 um (whichever is larger).
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement
Tx4Total Channel

Signal Group: Tx

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartEnd
CPUDevice01
BOTrace12
M1Trace23
M2Trace34
M3Trace45
CONNECTORDevice5-1

Material: None

Redriver/Retimer: None

PCIe Gen5 Add-in Card Clock Topology Mainstream, Tx Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)Max Length Segment Note
BODSL, MS, SL12.7
M1 + M2DSL, MS, SL
M3MS25.4
McardMS76.2Assumes an add-in card of 50.4 to 76.2 mm.

Min Length Total (mm): 50.8

Min Length Total Note: M_MB_TOTAL = BO + M1 + M2 + M3 : 50.8

Max Length Total (mm): 254

Max Length Total Note: M_MB_TOTAL = BO + M1 + M2 + M3: 50.8 mm to 178 mm (assuming 76 mm add-in card length)

PCIe Gen5 Device Down Clock Topology

PCIe Gen5 Device Down Clock Topology Diagram
Differential Clock Shielding
PCIe Gen5 Device Down Clock Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Signal isolationDifferential SRC Clocks supporting PCIe Gen5 devices require 0.76 mm (30 mils) isolation to adjacent high speed IOs. Isolation to other Differential Clocks, USB2 and low-speed IOs can be maintained at 0.5 mm (20 mils).
Reference planeContinuous ground only
EMC/ RF noise protection[1] For signal sections routed as microstrip on surface layer, a GND ring/ shield is advised to be added (follow standard GND ring/ shield guidelines for XTAL) with sufficient GND stitching vias for the length of the microstrip trace. [2] GND ring/ shield stitching vias should be placed at regular intervals of 4 - 12 mm. [3] It is advised to route in inner layer as stripline/ dual stripline routing. Limit microstrip routing and follow above shielding guidelines. [4] GND ring/ shield spacing to signal should be 4x the dielectric height of the stackup or approximately 300 um (whichever is larger). Clock signal spacing to other signals should follow the signal isolation guidelines . [5] GND ring/ shield width should be 2x the dielectric height of the stackup or approximately 140 um (whichever is larger).
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement

Differential Clock RCOMP

Description: CLK_S_RCOMP guidelines.

CLK_S_RCOMP Topology Diagram
CLK_S_RCOMP Shielding Guideline Diagram
Differential Clock RCOMP Notes
NoteDetail
Trace width / DC-resistanceNo requirement for trace width and isolation spacing as long as DC-resistance of <0.1 Ohm is met, but typically the guidelines for a 50 Ohm single-ended signal can be used.
Resistor value180 Ohm +/- 1% tolerance (178 Ohm +/- 1% tolerance is also acceptable)
LengthNo requirement as long as the below are met : 1) DC-resistance <0.1 Ohm 2) Parasitic capacitance of <1.5 pF (in order to avoid instability) As a reference, the external resistor should be placed as close as possible to the CPU (within 1" or 25.4 mm).
Other routing guidelines and shielding requirements1) Should be referenced to GND. 2) Noisy or switching references should be avoided. 3) As board space allows, it is recommended to add a GND shield at least 0.2 mm wide between the signal and other adjacent IO (especially high-speed IO). This is not required if the adjacent signal is another COMP signal. 4) PTH vias are required to be punched from this GND shield to the referenced GND plane. Example of shielding is provided in the shielding guidelines diagram.
Unused pinsUnused RCOMP can be left as not connected.

Type-C AUX

Type-C AUX Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.125
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.25
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)No0
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

TYPE-C AUX Retimer Topology

Type-C AUX With Retimer Topology Diagram
TYPE-C AUX Retimer Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Number of vias allowedNo explicit limit, use best known routing practices.
Transmission line referencingReference planes can be continuous ground or continuous power that have low frequency peak to peak noise. Ground referencing is preferred.
ESDRefer to USB4 ESD approved list in BR HR collateral.
AC cap valueNominal 100 nF recommended (75 nF to 200 nF including tolerance).AC Cap is needed for Barlow Ridge, and not for Gothic Bridge/Hayden Bridge retimer.
RetimerApplies to Barlow ridge,Gothic Bridge and Hayden bridge topology. Consult retimer datasheet for exact Aux channel implementation requirements.
Optional edge rate controlAn edge rate reduction mechanism may be needed to comply with DisplayPort maximum Aux slew rate specification dependent on the retimer's Aux implementation.
Cs cap value47 pF nominal.
Pull-up voltage for DP_AUX_N3.3v.

RetimerHyden Bridge and Gothic Bridge

Edge rate controlAn edge rate reduction mechanism such as a 47 pF capacitor (Cs) terminated to VSS is recommended. Cs cap is optional.

Type-C AUX No Retimer Topology (Internal Only)

Type-C AUX No Retimer Topology Diagram
Type-C AUX No Retimer Topology (Internal Only) Notes
NoteDetail
Number of vias allowedNo explicit limit, use best known routing practices.
Transmission line referencingReference planes can be continuous ground or continuous power that have low frequency peak to peak noise. Ground referencing is preferred.
ESD/ EOSRefer to EMC chapter for parts recommendation. Recommend placeholder. Component must be stuffed if EMC tests fail
AC cap valueNominal 100 nF recommended (75 nF to 200 nF including tolerance).
3.3 V GPIO AUX termination set based on USB Type-C plug orientation requirements. Nominal 3.3 V or 0 V.
Cs cap value47 pF nominal.
Edge rate controlAn edge rate reduction mechanism such as a 47 pF capacitor (Cs) terminated to VSS is recommended to comply with DisplayPort maximum Aux slew rate specification.

Type-C AUX No Retimer Internal Cable Topology (Internal Only)

Type-C AUX No Retimer Internal Cable Topology Diagram
Type-C AUX No Retimer Internal Cable Topology (Internal Only) Notes
NoteDetail
Number of vias allowedNo explicit limit, use best known routing practices.
Transmission line referencingReference planes can be continuous ground or continuous power that have low frequency peak to peak noise. Ground referencing is preferred.
500 mm cable assembly75 - 100 Ω including tolerance. Insertion loss ≥ -1.0 dB @ 1 MHz.
ESD/ EOSRefer to EMC chapter for parts recommendation. Recommend placeholder. Component must be stuffed if EMC tests fail
AC cap valueNominal 100 nF recommended (75 nF to 200 nF including tolerance).
3.3 V GPIO AUX termination set based on USB Type-C plug orientation requirements. Nominal 3.3 V or 0 V.
Cs cap value47 pF nominal.
Edge rate controlAn edge rate reduction mechanism such as a 47 pF capacitor (Cs) terminated to VSS is recommended to comply with DisplayPort maximum Aux slew rate specification.

DP AUX Dual Mode Protection Circuit

DP AUX Dual Mode Protection Circuit
DP AUX Dual Mode Protection Circuit Notes
NoteDetail
Power railsPower rails which will turn off in S3-S5 sleep states.
Inverter voltage railsPowered from suspend rails.
VCC-A1.8 V
VCC-C3.3 V
U1I2C Voltage Level Translator, TCA9406 or equivalent.
Pass gate FETEnsure the body diode of the FETs are connected as shown in the figure.
Pass gate FET alternativeDevices such as a TTL compatible FET multiplexer/ demultiplexer.
R1 resistorOptional, 2.7 kΩ ± 5%.
Rterm10 kΩ for TCA9406. Rterm value is part dependent.
R2 resistor value2.7 kΩ ± 5%. This is with the assumption of Rterm = 10 kΩ for U1, to achieve 2.2 kΩ of effective parallel resistance.
Effective parallel resistance of Rterm and R22.2 kΩ ± 10%.
Inverter leakage currentMinimize leakage current of inverter closest to DP connector to maintain input voltage level due to 1 Mohm pulldown resistor.
C1 cap valueNominal 100 nF recommended (75 nF to 200 nF including tolerance).
Cs cap value47 pF nominal.
Edge rate controlAn edge rate reduction mechanism such as a 47 pF capacitor (Cs) terminated to VSS is recommended to comply with DisplayPort maximum Aux slew rate specification .

DP Hot Plug Detect Implementation

DP Hot Plug Detect Implementation Diagram
DP Hot Plug Detect Implementation Notes
NoteDetail
RoutingRecommend 45 Ω nominal trace impedance with reasonable noise isolation.
VCC1.8 V
R1100 kΩ ± 5%
R2100 kΩ ± 5%
Q1BSS138p or equivalent, 0.85 V < VGS threshold < 1.95 V, input capacitance < 1 nF.
ConnectivityEnsure to follow the vendor data sheet for any additional HPD connectivity requirements.
ESDOptional, 3.3 V tolerant.

Signal Group: Rx

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartSource PinEndTarget PinTransistor Pin Map
CPUDevice01DDrain
Q1Transistor1G2Gate
Q1Transistor1S6Source
ESDDevice34
DP ConnectorDevice4-1
GNDGround6-1
R2Resistor56
placeholderDevice25
placeholderDevice23
R1Resistor78
VCCRail8-1
CPUDevice07

Barlow Ridge Type-C and DP Aux Topology (Internal Only)

Barlow Ridge Type-C AUX Topology Diagram
Barlow Ridge Type-C and DP Aux Topology (Internal Only) Notes
NoteDetail
Number of vias allowedNo explicit limit, use best known routing practices.
Transmission line referencingReference planes can be continuous ground or continuous power that have low frequency peak to peak noise. Ground referencing is preferred.
ESDRefer to EMC chapter for parts recommendation. Optional.
EOSRefer to Barlow Ridge Design Guide for parts recommendation (#736855).
Cs cap valueEdge rate control, 47 pF nominal. Optional.
C1, C2 cap valueNominal 100 nF recommended (75 nF to 200 nF including tolerance).
Type-C AC coupling and termination For Type-C ports Barlow Ridge integrates the aux pull-up, pull-down and AC coupling capacitor. For DP port aux channel discrete parts are required as shown in the topology diagram.

Mainstream, Tx

Category: Mainstream

Material: None

Signal Group: Tx

Redriver/Retimer: None

Barlow Ridge Type-C and DP Aux Topology (Internal Only) Mainstream, Tx Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)
BOMS, DSL, SL25
M1+M2MS, DSL, SL450
M3+M4+M5MS, DSL, SL127

Max Length Total (mm): 450

DP TCP

DP TCP General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Voiding recommendationIt is recommended to void unused (non-functional) pads for differential vias and pin pads for CMCs, ESDs and connectors to optimize the impedance matching in the channel. Voiding of 0402 or smaller AC capacitors pads is not necessary.
Unused signalsUnused data and AUX signals should be left no connected at the BGA ball.
ConnectorNo native DP connector topologies are supported.
Reference planeMicrostrip: Must be continuous ground Stripline: Ground on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a IO rail power plane with Iccmax < 5A that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground. Dual Stripline: Ground on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a IO rail power plane with Iccmax < 5A that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route.
DP TCP Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.125
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.25
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)Yes25

DP TCP UHBR20 Barlow Ridge Topology

DP TCP UHBR20 Barlow Ridge Topology Diagram
DP TCP UHBR20 Barlow Ridge Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Maximum via stub length250 um per via
Routing styleMicrostrip main route routing must be interleaved. To reduce system RFI/ EMI, it is recommended to use SL instead of MS. If MS routing is needed, refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.
AC cap valueNominal 100 nF recommended (75 nF to 265 nF including tolerance).
Total insertion loss budget from CPU pins to Barlow Ridge pins17 dB @ 10 GHz. Inclusive of HVM variation.
Supported interfacesDP2.1 (UHBR20).
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement
Tx2Total Channel

via1Via23
M1Trace38
via2Via89
M2Trace94
AC CAPCapacitor45
M3Trace56

DP TCP UHBR20 Cascaded Retimer_ Mux topology
DP TCP UHBR20 Cascaded Retimer/Mux topology Notes
NoteDetail
Maximum via stub length250 um per via
Routing styleMicrostrip main route routing must be interleaved. To reduce system RFI/ EMI, it is recommended to use SL instead of MS. If MS routing is needed, refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.
AC cap valueNominal 100 nF recommended (75 nF to 265 nF including tolerance).
Total insertion loss budget from CPU pins to retimer/MUX pins17 dB @ 10 GHz. Inclusive of HVM variation.
Supported interfacesDP2.1 (UHBR20).
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
RETIMERBarlow ridge and Parade mux/retimer. Retimer Rx should meet VESA spec requirements.

(Internal only) DP TCP UHBR20 Retimer Topology

DP TCP UHBR20 Retimer Topology Diagram
(Internal only) DP TCP UHBR20 Retimer Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Maximum via stub length250 um per via between CPU and retimer. Retimer post-channel cannot have via stub.
Routing styleStripline strongly recommended to reduce RFI/ EMI. If microstrip routing is needed, refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a power plane that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a power plane that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route.
CMCFor recommended part numbers, please refer to the EMC Component Selection section. Optional. Populating will not reduce the supported length.
ESDFor recommended part numbers, please refer to the EMC Component Selection section.
AC cap value75 nF to 265 nF including tolerance.
RetimerAssumed DP spec reference CTLE+DFE EQ.
Length from retimer to DP connectorSuperseded by retimer vendor recommendations.
ConnectorEnhanced mDP connector
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement
Tx2Pre-Channel
Tx2Post-Channel

Signal Group: Tx

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartEnd
TXDevice01
BOTrace12
M1Trace23
M2Trace34
AC CAPCapacitor45
RETIMERDevice56
M3Trace67
AC CAP1Capacitor78
M4Trace89
VIA1Via910
CMCDevice1011
M5Trace1112
VIA2Via1213
ESDDevice1314
M6Trace1415
ENHANCED mDP CONNECTORDevice15-1

eDP

Description: Guidelines are same for eDP DDI and TCP

eDP General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Voiding recommendationIt is recommended to void unused (non-functional) pads for differential vias, and pin pads for CMCs, ESDs and connectors to optimize the impedance matching in the channel. Voiding of 0402 or smaller AC capacitors pads is not necessary.
Reference planesMicrostrip: Must be continuous ground Stripline: Ground on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a IO rail power plane with Iccmax < 5A that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground. Dual Stripline: Ground on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a IO rail power plane with Iccmax < 5A that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route.
eDP Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.125
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.25
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)Yes25

eDP Auxiliary Main Link Topology

eDP Auxilary Main Link Topology Diagram
eDP Auxiliary Main Link Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Number of vias allowedNo explicit limit, use best known routing practices.
Transmission line referencingReference planes can be continuous ground or continuous power that have low frequency peak to peak noise. Ground referencing is preferred.
AC cap value 75 nF to 200 nF including tolerance.
Cable assembly75 - 100 Ω including tolerance. Insertion loss ≥ -1.0 dB @ 1 MHz.

eDP HBR3 Main Link CTLE Topology

eDP HBR3 Main Link CTLE Topology Diagram
eDP HBR3 Main Link CTLE Topology Notes
NoteDetail
CMCRefer to Electromagnetic Compatibility chapter (Common Mode Choke Selection).Optional. Populating will not reduce the supported length.
AC cap value75 nF to 265 nF including tolerance.
355 mm cable assembly (micro coaxial)Cable length: 355 mm for micro-coax with the following assumptions 25 mm assembly insertion loss >= -0.62 dB @ 4.05 GHz 355 mm cable assembly insertion loss >= -5.1 dB @ 4.05 GHz 80 - 100 ohms characteristic impedance including tolerance
Twisted pair cable assemblyRefer to "ADL_TwistedPair_CableSpec_eDP_TWP_Rev0p7" document #644925. This document describes the electrical parameter limits for the twisted pair cables assumed for this topology. It does not consider any EMI/ RFI risks.
TCON RX equalizationCTLE only.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
eDP HBR2 max lengthRefer to eDP HBR3 Main Link CTLE+DFE Topology recommendation for HBR2 Main Link Topology max length.

NoteDetail

AC cap value75 nF to 265 nF including tolerance.
Mux component guidelinesUse a passive mux with the following parameters: Differential insertion loss @ 4.05 GHz > -2.2 dB Differential return loss @ 4.05 GHz < -8.0 dB Differential FEXT @ 4.05 GHz < -50 dB
355 mm cable assembly (micro coaxial)Cable length: 355 mm for micro-coax with the following assumptions 25 mm assembly insertion loss >= -0.62 dB @ 4.05 GHz 355 mm cable assembly insertion loss >= -5.1 dB @ 4.05 GHz 80 - 100 ohms characteristic impedance including tolerance

eDP Hot Plug Detect Implementation

eDP Hot Plug Detect Implementation Diagram
eDP Hot Plug Detect Implementation Notes
NoteDetail
RoutingRecommend 45 Ω nominal trace impedance with reasonable noise isolation.
VCC1.25 V
R1100 kΩ ± 5%
R2100 kΩ ± 5%
Q1For panel implementing eDP HPD: BSS138p or equivalent (0.85 V < VGS threshold < 1.95 V, input capacitance < 1 nF) For panel implementing eDP LVHPD: RU1J002YN or equivalent (0.35 V < VGS < 0.8 V, input capacitance < 1 nF)
ConnectivityFollow the vendor data sheet for any additional HPD connectivity requirements.

HDMI TCP

HDMI TCP General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Length matching between pair to pair (inter pair)Within 13 mm (HDMI 2.1); 25 mm (HDMI 1.4).
Voiding recommendationIt is recommended to void unused (non-functional) pads for differential vias and pin pads for CMCs, ESDs and connectors to optimize the impedance matching in the channel. Voiding of 0402 or smaller AC capacitors pads is not necessary.
Unused signalsUnused data and AUX signals should be left no connected at the BGA ball.
Routing and return via requirement near vertical transitionFor all vertical transitions, the differential transmission lines should be connected to the two vias symmetrically. Moreover, Vss return vias should be placed near the signal vias in an equidistant symmetrical manner and all signal vias should have identical Vss return vias around each of them.
Fiberweave notesMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Reference planeMicrostrip: Must be continuous ground Stripline: Ground on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a IO rail power plane with Iccmax < 5A that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground. Dual Stripline: Ground on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a IO rail power plane with Iccmax < 5A that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route.
HDMI TCP Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.125
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.25
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)Yes13
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0

HDMI TCP Re-timer 12G Topology

HDMI TCP Re-timer 12G Topology Diagram
HDMI TCP Re-timer 12G Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Number of vias allowedMax 2 vias.
Maximum via stub length250 um per via.
CMCOptional. For recommended part numbers, please refer to the EMC Component Selection section. Populating will not reduce the supported length.
ESDFor recommended part numbers, please refer to the EMC Component Selection section. Optional if Retimer has integrated ESD that meets discharge requirements.
AC cap value85 nF to 200 nF including tolerances.
Re-timerRe-timer Rx must be spec compliable for HDMI 2.1a FRL source requirements at TP2_EQ
Max supported HDMI 1.4b TMDS data rate3.4 Gbps
Max supported HDMI 2.1 TMDS data rate6.0 Gbps
Max supported HDMI 2.1 FRL data rate12 Gbps
Retimer sideband communicationAny port configured to support HDMI must implement sideband communications via the DDC (I2C) channel associated with that HDMI port as defined in the Video BIOS Table (VBT).
ConnectorConnector shall meet all Category 3 requirements defined by the HDMI1.4b spec (Pin assignment, contact sequence, mechanical performance, electrical performance, environmental characteristics, connector drawings) in addition to the electrical performance requirements listed in HDMI2.1 spec which are defined by compliance parametric electrical tests HFR6-1 (Mated Connector Differential Impedance), HFR6-2 (Mated Connector Attenuation - Differential Insertion Loss) and HFR6-3 (Mated Connector Attenuation to Far-End Crosstalk Ratio) and must be included within the “Approved Category 3 Connector list” defined by the HDMI Licensing Administrator Inc.
Routing styleTo reduce system RFI/ EMI, it is recommended to use SL instead of MS. If MS routing is needed, refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.

Signal Group: Tx

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartEnd
TXDevice01
BOTrace12
M1Trace23
M2Trace34
AC CAPCapacitor45
RETIMERDevice56
M3Trace67
CMCDevice78
M4Trace89
ESDDevice910
M5Trace1011
HDMI CONNECTORDevice11-1

NoteDetail
Number of vias allowedMax 3 vias.

CMCOptional. For recommended part numbers, please refer to the EMC Component Selection section. Populating will not reduce the supported length.

AC cap value85 nF to 200 nF including tolerances.
RedriverRe-driver Equalization should be selected accordingly to compensate the pre-channel loss, PS8219 Re-driver
Max supported HDMI 1.4b TMDS data rate3.4 Gbps
Max supported HDMI 2.1 TMDS data rate6.0 Gbps
Max supported HDMI 2.1 FRL data rate12 Gbps
Retimer sideband communicationAny port configured to support HDMI must implement sideband communications via the DDC (I2C) channel associated with that HDMI port as defined in the Video BIOS Table (VBT).
ConnectorConnector shall meet all Category 3 requirements defined by the HDMI1.4b spec (Pin assignment, contact sequence, mechanical performance, electrical performance, environmental characteristics, connector drawings) in addition to the electrical performance requirements listed in HDMI2.1 spec which are defined by compliance parametric electrical tests HFR6-1 (Mated Connector Differential Impedance), HFR6-2 (Mated Connector Attenuation - Differential Insertion Loss) and HFR6-3 (Mated Connector Attenuation to Far-End Crosstalk Ratio) and must be included within the “Approved Category 3 Connector list” defined by the HDMI Licensing Administrator Inc.
Routing styleTo reduce system RFI/ EMI, it is recommended to use SL instead of MS. If MS routing is needed, refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.

(Internal RVP) HDMI TCP Re-driver 12G M.2 Connector Topology

HDMI TCP Redriver 12G M.2 connector Topology Diagram
(Internal RVP) HDMI TCP Re-driver 12G M.2 Connector Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Number of vias allowedMax 3 vias.
Maximum via stub length250 um per via.
Reference plane for microstrip routeContinuous ground or continuous power that has low frequency peak to peak noise, ground preferred.
Reference plane for stripline and dual stripline routeBoth sides can either be continuous ground or continuous power that has low frequency peak to peak noise, ground preferred.
CMCOptional. For recommended part numbers, please refer to the EMC Component Selection section. Populating will not reduce the supported length.
ESDFor recommended part numbers, please refer to the EMC Component Selection section. Optional if Retimer has integrated ESD that meets discharge requirements.
AC cap value85 nF to 200 nF including tolerances.
RedriverRe-driver Equalization should be selected accordingly to compensate the pre-channel loss
Max supported HDMI 1.4b TMDS data rate3.4 Gbps
Max supported HDMI 2.1 TMDS data rate6.0 Gbps
Max supported HDMI 2.1 FRL data rate12 Gbps
Retimer sideband communicationAny port configured to support HDMI must implement sideband communications via the DDC (I2C) channel associated with that HDMI port as defined in the Video BIOS Table (VBT).
ConnectorConnector shall meet all Category 3 requirements defined by the HDMI1.4b spec (Pin assignment, contact sequence, mechanical performance, electrical performance, environmental characteristics, connector drawings) in addition to the electrical performance requirements listed in HDMI2.1 spec which are defined by compliance parametric electrical tests HFR6-1 (Mated Connector Differential Impedance), HFR6-2 (Mated Connector Attenuation - Differential Insertion Loss) and HFR6-3 (Mated Connector Attenuation to Far-End Crosstalk Ratio) and must be included within the “Approved Category 3 Connector list” defined by the HDMI Licensing Administrator Inc.
Routing styleTo reduce system RFI/ EMI, it is recommended to use SL instead of MS. If MS routing is needed, refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.

HDMI Hot Plug Detect Implementation

HDMI Hot Plug Detect Implementation Diagram
HDMI Hot Plug Detect Implementation Notes
NoteDetail
RoutingRecommend 45 Ω nominal trace impedance with reasonable noise isolation.
VCC1.8 V
R1100 kΩ ±5%
R2100 kΩ ±5%
Q1BSS138p or equivalent, 0.85 V < VGS threshold < 1.95 V, input capacitance < 1 nF.
ConnectivityEnsure to follow the vendor data sheet for any additional HPD connectivity requirements.
ESDOptional, 5 V tolerant.

HDMI TCP DDC Topology

HDMI DDC Direct Connect Topology Diagram
HDMI DDC Buffered Topology Diagram
HDMI TCP DDC Topology Notes
NoteDetail
RoutingTotal length from driver to HDMI connector is limited by spec capacitance limit of 50 pF including trace capacitance and discrete. Please refer to I2C section for calculation details.
Power railsPower rails which will turn off in S3-S5 sleep states.
VCC-A1.8 V
VCC-B5 V
VCC-C3.3 V
U1 I2C Voltage Level Translator, TCA9509 or equivalent.
R1 resistor10 kΩ ± 5%
R2 resistor1.5 kΩ ± 5%
Back drive current protectionMax capacitance for back drive current protection Schottky diode is 10 pF. Must use diode of Schottky type to minimize voltage drop.
I2C guidanceDDC signals follow I2C guidelines.
Alternative implementations Depending on the Active Level Shifter implemented the DDC implementation may vary. Please refer to the vendors requirements for any changes in implementation.
Active level shifter partFollow Active Level Shifter datasheet recommendation as SDA/SCL signals may be optional depending on the part requirements. Component may be removed from the topology diagram if SDA/SCL connections are not required.
ESDFor recommended part numbers, please refer to the EMC Component Selection section.
Cs cap value47 pF nominal.
Edge rate controlAn edge rate reduction mechanism such as a 47 pF capacitor (Cs) terminated to VSS is recommended to comply with DisplayPort maximum Aux slew rate specification .

Mainstream, Tx

Category: Mainstream

Material: None

Signal Group: Tx

Redriver/Retimer: None

PCIe Gen 1-3

Type-4 PCB Via Stitching Recommendation
Recommended GND Stitching Via Placement
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation Toe Side HSIO Routing
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation SMT footprint Voiding Reference
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation AC Cap Voiding
PCIE4 M.2 Connector Voiding Recommendation
PCIE4 M.2 Connector Toe and Heel GND Via Recommendation
PCIe Gen 1-3 General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Reference plane(1) Continuous GND is recommended. (2) If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). IO power rails with less than 5A max current can be considered for dual reference implementation. (3) If non-continuous power referencing is unavoidable on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt), but stitching caps are required over each plane split and need to be placed within 6 mm of a signal running across the plane split.
Voiding recommendation for mainstream stackupIt is recommended to void unused (non-functional) pads for differential vias and pin pads for ESDs, AC caps and connectors to optimize the impedance matching in the channel.
PCIe1, PCIe2, PCIe3 discrete component part size for mainstream stackupIt is recommended to use 0402 or smaller component sizes.
Unused signalsUnused data signals should be left as no connect at the ball.
Interleave requirementRefer to topology section for details.
PCIe1, PCIe2, PCIe3 max via stub length< 900 um
Routing and return via requirement near vertical transitionFor all vertical transitions, the differential transmission line should be connected to the two vias symmetrically. Moreover, Vss return vias should be placed near the signal vias in an equidistant symmetrical manner, and all signal vias should have identical Vss return vias around each of them.
PTH connector voiding requirementDifferential Oval Anti Pad required for all layers.
Voiding under CEM SMT connector padsRequired
General Guidelines
NoteDetail
0 Ohm resistor for PCIe1, PCIe2, PCIe30402 or smaller size . Component pads reference plane needs to be voided.
PCIe1, PCIe2, PCIe3 discrete component part size for thin stackupIt is required to use 0201.
Voiding recommendation for thin stackupIt is required to void unused (non-functional) pads reference plane for differential vias and pin pads for ESDs, AC caps and connectors to optimize the impedance matching in the channel.
PCIe Gen 1-3 Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.125
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.25
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)No0
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

PCIe Gen1 Device Down Topology

PCIe Gen1 Device Down Topology Diagram
PCIe Gen1 Device Down Topology Notes
NoteDetail
AC capacitor valueGen1: 75 nF - 265 nF Gen1 nominal = 100 nF
Breakout length and spacingAn initial breakout segment of 4 mm in length with a tighter pair-to-pair spacing of 0.11 mm - 0.16 mm is allowed. The maximum total breakout length is still 15.2 mm.
Routing type for mainstream stackupPrefer non-interleaved routes in different layers.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia PlacementNotes
Rx, Tx6Total ChannelGEN1 (not counting microvia under package)

Signal MRTS

M1Trace23
M2Trace34

M3Trace56

M3MS8

Max Length Total Note: Max length is BO+M1+M2+M3 < 356 mm

PCIe Gen1 Internal Cable Topology

PCIe Gen1 Internal Cable Topology Diagram
PCIe Gen1 Internal Cable Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Add-in-card (M4 + M5)The total length of the add-in card (M4 + M5) is usually 38 mm to 50.4 mm. The M4 + M5 segment is a combination of MS/ SL/ DSL (MS where required to connect to surface mounted components). The M4 + M5 segment has a typical via count of 1.
AC capacitor valueGen1: 75 nF - 265 nF Gen1 nominal = 100 nF
Cable loss vs channel length trade-off tableSee PCIe with internal cable routing length versus cable loss figure.
Breakout length and spacingAn initial breakout segment of 4 mm in length with a tighter pair-to-pair spacing of 0.11 mm - 0.16 mm is allowed. The total breakout length is still 15.2 mm.
Clarification on M2 segment for RXThe M2 segment for RX can also be routed on SL or DSL and not limited to MS.
Routing type for mainstream stackupPrefer non-interleaved routes in different layers.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia PlacementNotes
Tx2Total ChannelGEN1 (not counting microvia under package).
Rx1Total ChannelGEN1 (not counting microvia under package).
Rx, Tx1Post-ChannelDaughter card/Add-in card

PCIe Gen1 M.2 Topology

PCIe Gen1 M.2 Topology Diagram
PCIe Gen1 M.2 Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Add-in-card (M4 + M5)The total length of the add-in card (M4 + M5) is usually 38 mm to 50.4 mm. The M4 + M5 segment is a combination of MS/ SL/ DSL (MS where required to connect to surface mounted components). The M4 + M5 segment has a typical via count of 1.
AC capacitor valueGen1: 75 nF - 265 nF Gen1 nominal = 100 nF
Breakout length and spacingAn initial breakout segment of 4 mm in length with a tighter pair-to-pair spacing of 0.11 mm - 0.16 mm is allowed. The total breakout length is still 15.2 mm.
Routing type for mainstream stackupPrefer non-interleaved routes in different layers.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia PlacementNotes
Rx, Tx4Total ChannelGEN1 (not counting microvia under package).

PCIe Gen2 Internal Cable Topology

PCIe Gen2 Internal Cable Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Add-in-card (M4 + M5)The total length of the add-in card (M4 + M5) is usually 38 mm to 50.4 mm. The M4 + M5 segment is a combination of MS/ SL/ DSL (MS where required to connect to surface mounted components). The M4 + M5 segment has a typical via count of 1.
AC capacitor valueGen2: 75 nF - 265 nF Gen2 nominal = 100 nF
Cable loss vs channel length trade-off tableSee PCIe with internal cable routing length versus cable loss figure.
Breakout length and spacingAn initial breakout segment of 4 mm in length with a tighter pair-to-pair spacing of 0.11 mm - 0.16 mm is allowed. The total breakout length is still 15.2 mm.
Clarification on M2 segment for RXThe M2 segment for RX can also be routed on SL or DSL and not limited to MS.
Routing type for mainstream stackupPrefer non-interleaved routes in different layers.

Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia PlacementNotes

PCIe Gen 4

Type-4 PCB Via Stitching Recommendation
Recommended GND Stitching Via Placement
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation SMT footprint Voiding Reference
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation AC Cap Voiding
PCIE4 M.2 Connector Voiding Recommendation
PCIE4 M.2 Connector Toe and Heel GND Via Recommendation
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation Toe Side HSIO Routing
PCIe Gen 4 General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Reference plane(1) Continuous GND is recommended. (2) If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). IO power rails with less than 5A max current can be considered for dual reference implementation. (3) If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt), but stitching caps are required over each plane split and need to be placed within 6 mm of a signal running across the plane split.
Voiding recommendation for mainstream stackupIt is recommended to void unused (non-functional) pads reference plane for differential vias and pin pads for ESDs, AC caps and connectors to optimize the impedance matching in the channel.
PCIe4 AC capacitor size for mainstream stackupIt is required to use 0402. If routing near maximum length it is recommended to use 0201 component size.
Unused signalsUnused data signals should be left as no connect at the ball.
Interleaved requirementRefer to topology section for details.
PCIe4 max via stub length< 250 um
Via stub length relaxationPTH via stub length can be relaxed, refer to "MTL-UH PCIe Gen4 Stub Length Requirement Relaxation White Paper" #723631 for details.
Routing and return via requirement near vertical transitionFor all vertical transitions, the differential transmission line should be connected to the two vias symmetrically. Moreover, Vss return vias should be placed near the signal vias in an equidistant symmetrical manner, and all signal vias should have identical Vss return vias around each of them.
PTH connector voiding requirementDifferential Oval Anti Pad required for all layers. For PCIe4, see topology specific notes for additional guidance.
Voiding under CEM SMT connector padsRequired
Fiberweave for PCIe4Must adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
PCIe4 redriverRouting length can be extended beyond the PDG guidelines by using redriver. Refer to document #575423 for details.
General Guidelines
NoteDetail
0 Ohm resistor for PCIe1, PCIe2, PCIe30402 or smaller size . Component pads need to be voided.
PCIe1, PCIe2, PCIe3 discrete component part size for thin stackupIt is required to use 0201.
Voiding recommendation for thin stackupIt is required to void unused (non-functional) pads for differential vias and pin pads for ESDs, AC caps and connectors to optimize the impedance matching in the channel.
Backdrill for PCB PTHSignals can transition between any PCB layers as long as the maximum via / PTH stub length is < 250 um. Use backdrill to reduce stub length to meet < 250 um requirement.
PCIe Gen 4 Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.125
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.25
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)No0
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

PCIe Gen4 Barlow Ridge Topology

PCIe Gen4 Barlow Ridge Topology Diagram
PCIe Gen4 Barlow Ridge Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Maximum via stub length for mainstream stackup250 um per via.
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground. Prefer ground on both sides.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route. Prefer ground on both sides.
AC cap valueNominal 220 nF recommended for Gen3 & Gen4 (spec range 75 nF to 265 nF including tolerance).
Routing type for mainstream stackupPrefer non-interleaved routes in different layers.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Device / End Point package insertion lossDevice / End Point needs to be within the 3 dB specification as per the PCIe Base Spec Rev 4.0 Version 1.0.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement
Rx, Tx4Total Channel

Signal Group: Rx, Tx

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartEnd
RX, TXDevice01
BOTrace12
M1Trace23
M2Trace34
M3Trace45
AC CapCapacitor56
M4Trace67
TX, RXDevice7-1

Material: None

Signal Group: Rx, Tx

Redriver/Retimer: None

PCIe Gen4 Barlow Ridge Topology Mainstream, Rx,Tx Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)Max Length Segment Note
BOMS, DSL, SL12.7
M1+M2+M3MS, DSL, SLMax length is BO+M1+M2+M3+M4 < 304 mm
M4MS12.7

Max Length Total (mm): 304

Max Length Total Note: Max length is BO+M1+M2+M3+M4 < 304 mm (Applies only to mid-loss stack-up and devices which support PCIe Gen4 max insertion loss).

Maximum via stub length for mainstream stackup250 um per via.
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground. Prefer ground on both sides.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route. Prefer ground on both sides.
AC cap valueNominal 220 nF recommended for Gen3 & Gen4 (spec range 75 nF to 265 nF including tolerance).
Routing type for mainstream stackupPrefer non-interleaved routes in different layers.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Device / End Point package insertion lossDevice / End Point needs to be within the 3 dB specification as per the PCIe Base Spec Rev 4.0 Version 1.0.

PCIe Gen4 M.2 Topology

PCIe Gen4 M.2 Topology Diagram
PCIe Gen4 M.2 Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Maximum via stub length for mainstream stackup250 um per via.
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground. Prefer ground on both sides.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route. Prefer ground on both sides.
AC cap valueNominal 220 nF recommended for Gen3 and Gen4 (spec range 75 nF to 265 nF including tolerance).
Routing type for mainstream stackupPrefer non-Interleaved routes in different layers.
M.2 connector Vss pad to via distanceEach M.2 connector Vss pad should be connected to its own Vss via. The distance between the edge of the pad and the edge of the via pad should be 0.5mm (19 mils) max.
Add-in cardAssuming ~50 mm of PCB routing and 2 vias with spec reference package.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Notes
NoteDetail
Backdrilled viaAllow for exit backdrill via of 250 um with 180 um entry stub.

Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement

(Internal Validation) PCIe Gen4 CEM Topology

PCIe Gen4 CEM Topology Diagram
PCIe Gen4 CEM Connector Antipad Optimization
PCIE4 CEM Connector Sideband Optimization
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation Connector Voiding
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation Toe and Heel GND Via 1
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation Toe and Heel GND Via 2
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation SMT footprint Voiding Reference
PCIe Board Layout Recommendation_ Toe Side HSIO Routing
(Internal Validation) PCIe Gen4 CEM Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Maximum via stub length for mainstream stackup250 um per via.
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground. Prefer ground on both sides.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route. Prefer ground on both sides.
AC cap ValueNominal 220 nF recommended for Gen3/ 4 (spec range 75 nF to 265 nF including tolerance).
Routing type for mainstream stackupPrefer non-Interleaved routes in different layers.
CEM connector Vss pad to via distanceEach CEM connector Vss pad should be connected to its own Vss via. The distance between the edge of the pad and the edge of the via pad should be 0.5mm (19 mils) max.
Add-in cardAssuming ~76 mm of PCB routing with spec reference package.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Notes
NoteDetail
Backdrilled viaAllow for exit backdrill via of 250 um with 180 um entry stub.

PCIe Gen 5

Description: Only 4Tx and 4Rx PCIe Lanes (namely C9 to C12) are available in PTL-H404 and PTL-H12Xe SKU. Extra 8 Tx and 8 Rx lanes are available in PTL-H484 SKU (namely D13 to D20) only. Those extra 8 lanes (D13 to D20) lanes are no connect in package for PTL-H404 and PTL-H12Xe SKUs.

PCIE5 Board Layout Recommendation AC Cap Voiding
Void above and below buried vias PTH pads in T4 stackups
Void under SOC ball pads
PCIe Gen 5 General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Voiding recommendationIt is recommended to void unused (non-functional) pads for differential vias and pin pads for ESDs, AC caps and connectors to optimize the impedance matching in the channel.
PCIe5 AC capacitor sizeIt is required to use 0201 . Void reference layer under pad size of differential cap together. Extend void by 50um (2 mils) on all sides of pads. Reference example provided per figure. Ensure spacing between P and N cap is about ~305 um (~12 mils) and spacing between caps of different pair caps is more than 762 um (30 mils).
Unused signalsUnused data signals should be left as no connect at the ball.
Interleaved requirementPrefer non-interleaved routing. If Tx to Rx is routed same layer, need Signal-to-Non-Equivalent-Signal (S-Non-ES) spacing as given in Tlinespec between Tx to Rx.
Routing and return via requirement near vertical transitionFor all vertical transitions, the differential transmission line should be connected to the two vias symmetrically. Moreover, Vss return vias should be placed near the signal vias in an equidistant symmetrical manner, and all signal vias should have identical Vss return vias around each of them.
Fiberweave for PCIe5Must adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Antipad for Via800um diameter for anti-pad Via. Please refer to chapter "General Design Considerations", subheading "Differential Transitional Via Recommendations" for image illustrating anti-pad diameter.
Void under SOC ball padsSecond PCB layer should have void equal to pad size for T3 stackup PCB. And for T4 stackup with Via in pad, need to void around pad in top layer equal to 300um radius size.
Void above and below buried via's PTH pads for T4 stackupNeed to provide void above and below buried via's PTH pads. Voids need to be 75um more in radius than pad radius. Void is required as shapes over big pads cause a capacitive dip in impedance which results in lower margins. The same void should be provided in layers in which via is running through as well i.e., for PTH from L3 to L8, if there is no shape in L2 and L9 already (because of it being signal layer), nothing is required to be done for L2/9.Void not required in L1/10. Ensure no routing below these voids for other signals in L1 & L10.In case surface layers are power, ensure it is symmetric to both p and n. Refer to the image provided as a reference.
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, only a single continuous power reference plane is permitted on one side, but the other side must be a continuous ground. Simulation is needed to ensure electrical requirements are met.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, only a single continuous power reference plane is permitted on one side, but the other side must be a continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route. Simulation is needed to ensure electrical requirements are met.
General Guidelines
NoteDetail
0 ohm resistor for PCIe50201 or smaller size . Component pads need to be voided.
Backdrill for PCB PTHSignals can transition between any PCB layers as long as the maximum via / PTH stub length is < 250 um. Use backdrill to reduce stub length to meet < 250 um requirement.
PCIe Gen 5 Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.125
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.125
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)No0
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

PCIe Gen5 Port operating at Gen4 Data Rate Device Down Topology

Description: Platform should avoid using the PCIe Gen 5 capable ports for gen4 device. Because even in gen4 speed, gen5 IP will use more power as compared gen4 IP both working at gen4 data rate.

(Internal Validation) PCIe Gen5 CEM Topology

PCIe Gen5 CEM Topology Diagram
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation CEM Connector Voiding
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation Toe and Heel GND Via 1
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation Toe and Heel GND Via 2
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation Toe Side HSIO Routing
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation SMT footprint Voiding Reference
(Internal Validation) PCIe Gen5 CEM Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Maximum via stub length250 um
AC cap valueNominal 220 nF recommended (spec range 176 nF to 265 nF including tolerance.). Use 0201 component size.
Add In Card Connector (CEM)Only SMT is supported.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Voiding under CEM SMT connector padsRequired .The connector footprint solder pad width for PCIe Gen 5.0 is 0.53 mm. The recommended void in reference plane extends 0.10 mm beyond the edges of the pads on three sides, with dimensions of 2.10 mm × 1.73 mm. Void should not extend from where signal is connected to pad. Attached imaged illustrate this. Please do signal Connection only from Toe side of SMT pad (the side where void is not extended).Gnd connection to SMT pads near main link should be less than 0.4mm from SMT pad edge to via pad edge. Routing high speed signals to the "heel" side of the SMT pads introduces a significant capacitive/resonant stub that would seriously degrade channel performance.

Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement

PCIe Gen5 M.2 Topology

PCIe Gen5 M.2 Topology
Suggested Ground Void for Main Board Mdot2 connector
Suggested_Toe_Side_Connection
PCIe Gen5 M.2 Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Maximum via stub length250 um per via.
AC cap valueNominal 220 nF recommended (spec range 75 nF to 265 nF including tolerance).
M.2 connectorEach M.2 connector Vss pad should be connected to its own Vss via on both side Toe and edge. The distance between the edge of the pad and the edge of the via pad should be 0.5 mm (19 mils) max.
Suggested Ground Void for Main Board Mdot2 connectorRefer to Image above. Top layer (or layer in which connector is placed) avoid ground shapes 200um away from signal pads. Void in Top layer should be bigger than void in L2 layer.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Gen5 M.2 operating at Gen4Please refer to PCIe Gen4 M.2 Topology chapter for lengths.

PCIe Gen5 M.2 internal Cable FFC Topology (RVP validation topology)

PCIe Gen5 M.2 internal Cable FFC Topology
M.2 test module gold finger optimisation
Suggested_Toe_Side_Connection
Suggested Ground Void for Main Board Mdot2 connector
PCIe Gen5 M.2 internal Cable FFC Topology (RVP validation topology) Notes
NoteDetail
Maximum via stub lengthno stub on Tx and min stub on Rx with back drill on RVP. No Via on M.2 test module.
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
AC cap valueNominal 220 nF recommended (spec range 75 nF to 265 nF including tolerance).
M.2 connectorEach M.2 connector Ground pad should be connected to its own Ground via on both side Toe and edge. The distance between the edge of the pad and the edge of the via pad should be 0.5 mm (19 mils) max.
Suggested Ground Void for Main Board Mdot2 connectorRefer to Image above. Top layer (or layer in which connector is placed) avoid ground shapes 200um away from signal pads. Void in Top layer should be bigger than void in L2 layer.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Gold finger voidingVoid 0.254mm extra than top pad size in all layers till N-2 layers. N-2-layer Void 0.254mm extra than bottom pad size. Please note pads on top and bottom do not align as per M.2 spec. This means m.2 test module need to have T4 or Skip Via stack up only as T3 Through via cannot be placed close to pad. Bottom pad extends longer than top pads.
Ground Gold finger pad Via connectionEach M.2 ground gold finger should be connected to its own ground via. The distance between the edge of the ground gold finger and the edge of the via pad should be 0.5 mm (19 mils) max.
M.2 moduleM.2 test module will use interleaved routing to avoid vias and layer transitions.

Signal GroupMax Number of Vias Allowed
Rx2
Tx1
