RCOMP

Description: HSIO RCOMP

example
RCOMP Connection Diagram
RCOMP General Guidelines
NoteDetail
CLK_S_RCOMP180 Ohm +/- 1% to GND Board Rdc: < 0.1 Ohm Board capacitance: < 1.5 pF Trace width 75um with min trace spacing 100um Max total length on board = 9 mm GND shield to any high speed IO with VSS trace/ strip GND reference required See Differential Clock section for more detailed notes.
CNV_RCOMP200 Ohm +/- 1% to GND Board Rdc: < 0.1 Ohm Board capacitance: < 1.5 pF Trace width 75um with min trace spacing 100um Max total length on board = 9 mm GND shield to any high speed IO with VSS trace/ strip GND reference required
CSI_RCOMP200 Ohm +/- 1% to GND Board Rdc: < 0.1 Ohm Board capacitance: < 1.5 pF Trace width 75um with min trace spacing 100um Max total length on board = 9 mm GND shield to any high speed IO with VSS trace/ strip GND reference required
DDI_RCOMP200 Ohm +/- 1% to GND Board Rdc: < 0.1 Ohm Board capacitance: < 1.5 pF Trace width 75um with min trace spacing 100um Max total length on board = 9 mm GND shield to any high speed IO with VSS trace/ strip GND reference required
PCIE_C_RCOMP200 Ohm +/- 1% to GND Board Rdc: < 0.1 Ohm Board capacitance: < 1.5 pF Trace width 75um with min trace spacing 100um Max total length on board = 9 mm GND shield to any high speed IO with VSS trace/ strip GND reference required
PCIE_D_RCOMP200 Ohm +/- 1% to GND Board Rdc: < 0.1 Ohm Board capacitance: < 1.5 pF Trace width 75um with min trace spacing 100um Max total length on board = 9 mm GND shield to any high speed IO with VSS trace/ strip GND reference required
PCIE_A_RCOMP200 Ohm +/- 1% to GND Board Rdc: < 0.1 Ohm Board capacitance: < 1.5 pF Trace width 75um with min trace spacing 100um Max total length on board = 9 mm GND shield to any high speed IO with VSS trace/ strip GND reference required
PCIE_B_RCOMP200 Ohm +/- 1% to GND Board Rdc: < 0.1 Ohm Board capacitance: < 1.5 pF Trace width 75um with min trace spacing 100um Max total length on board = 9 mm GND shield to any high speed IO with VSS trace/ strip GND reference required
TCP_RCOMP200 Ohm +/- 1% to GND Board Rdc: < 0.1 Ohm Board capacitance: < 1.5 pF Trace width 75um with min trace spacing 100um Max total length on board = 9 mm GND shield to any high speed IO with VSS trace/ strip GND reference required
USB2_1_RCOMP200 Ohm +/- 1% to GND Board Rdc: < 0.1 Ohm Board capacitance: < 1.5 pF Trace width 75um with min trace spacing 100um Max total length on board = 9 mm GND shield to any high speed IO with VSS trace/ strip GND reference required
USB2_2_RCOMP200 Ohm +/- 1% to GND Board Rdc: < 0.1 Ohm Board capacitance: < 1.5 pF Trace width 75um with min trace spacing 100um Max total length on board = 9 mm GND shield to any high speed IO with VSS trace/ strip GND reference required
USB32_RCOMP200 Ohm +/- 1% to GND Board Rdc: < 0.1 Ohm Board capacitance: < 1.5 pF Trace width 75um with min trace spacing 100um Max total length on board = 9 mm GND shield to any high speed IO with VSS trace/ strip GND reference required
RSVD_RCOMP200 Ohm +/- 1% to GND Board Rdc: < 0.1 Ohm Board capacitance: < 1.5 pF Trace width 75um with min trace spacing 100um Max total length on board = 9 mm GND shield to any high speed IO with VSS trace/ strip GND reference required
General Guidelines
NoteDetail
GeneralStrongly recommended to follow breakout board placement.
RCOMP Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequired
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)No
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)No
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)No
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)No
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No

Type-C TBT+USB+DP

Type-C TBT+USB+DP General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Voiding recommendation for mainstream stackupIt is recommended to void unused (non-functional) pads for differential vias and pin pads for ESDs, AC caps and connectors to optimize the impedance matching in the channel.
Optimal routingFor optimal performance it is recommended to begin layout with TBT routing, use arc routing and maintain 3H spacing to vias/ void/ splits. It's also recommended that return loss specification of routing from retimer to Type-C connector is met. It is listed in section 5.5.1.1. of Type-C specification (Document #557111).
Discrete component part size for mainstream stackupRecommend 0201 components. It is OK to use 0402 component between CPU and retimer when NOT routing near maximum length. Strongly recommend 0201 components between retimer and Type-C connector, 0402 components may result in return loss spec violation.
Recommended short protection circuitIt is recommended to include this circuit to comply with USB ECN \"RX AC Coupling Capacitor Option\" to provide ESD/ EOS protection and set RX bias at the Type-C connector. See notes on each topology for Intel's recommendation on DC rating of the Crx. The customer should consider short event to VBUS that can be up to 50 V.
Unused signalsUnused data and AUX signals should be left unconnected at the BGA ball.
Routing and return via requirement near vertical transitionFor all vertical transitions, the differential transmission lines should be connected to the two vias symmetrically. Moreover, Vss return vias should be placed near the signal vias in an equidistant symmetrical manner and all signal vias should have identical Vss return vias around each of them.
General Guidelines
NoteDetail
TCP0_dfx_dmonobs_n/p_lv[1:0]Do not include in external PDG. Route as 50 Ω single ended impedance traces. Provide good noise isolation (12 mil minimum). Connect to SMA/ SMP.
TCP0_dfx_amon_obs_lvDo not include in external PDG. Route as 50 Ω single ended impedance traces. Provide good noise isolation (12 mil minimum). Connect to SMA/ SMP.
Type-C TBT+USB+DP Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.125
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.125
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)Yes25
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)Yes25
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)Yes25
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

[To be Removed] Type-C TBT+USB+DP 20G Retimer Topology

Type-C TBT+USB+DP 20G Retimer Topology Diagram
[To be Removed] Type-C TBT+USB+DP 20G Retimer Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Number of vias allowed2 before retimer, 2 after retimer.
Maximum via stub length250 um per via between CPU and retimer. Retimer post-channel cannot have via stub.
Routing styleMicrostrip main route routing must be interleaved.
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a power plane that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a power plane that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route.
ESDOn-Semi ESDL2012 or ESDL2013. Alternative option: Semtech RClamp1011ZC.
AC cap value135 nF to 265 nF including tolerance. For the post-channel cap - Form factor: 0201 recommended. - Rated voltage: 25 V. When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: - Form factor: 0402 recommended. - Rated voltage: 63 V. For the pre-channel cap - Form factor: 0201 recommended. - Rated voltage: 6.3 V.
Crx cap value297 nF to 363 nF including tolerance. - Form factor: 0201 recommended. - Rated voltage: 25 V. When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: - Form factor: 0402 recommended. - Rated voltage: 63 V.
Rb resistor value220 kΩ ± 5% Form factor: 0201 recommended.
Rc resistor value2.2 Ω ± 10% - Form factor: 0201 recommended. When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: i. If EPR is @ 28 V, then Rc should be 2.7 Ω ± 5%. ii. If EPR is @ 36 V, then Rc should be 3.24 Ω ± 5%. iii. If EPR is @ 48 V, then Rc should be 4.02 Ω ± 5%.
TX bleed resistor placeholderRecommended having a placeholder for an 0201 Rb resistor between the AC cap and Type-C connector on the SSTX pairs.
RetimerHayden Bridge
Total insertion loss budget from CPU pins to retimer pins15.5 dB @ 5 GHz. Inclusive of HVM variation.
Total insertion loss budget from retimer pins to Type-C connector pads4.5 dB @ 5 GHz. Inclusive of HVM variation. Not inclusive of the connector.
Supported interfacesThunderbolt 3.0, USB 4.0 Gen2, USB3.2 Gen2x2 and DP2.1 (UHBR10).
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).

Mainstream, Rx,Tx, Post-Channel

Category: Mainstream

Material: None

Signal Group: Rx, Tx

Redriver/Retimer: Post-Channel

[To be Removed] Type-C TBT+USB+DP 20G Retimer Topology Mainstream, Rx,Tx, Post-Channel Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)
M3+M4+M5DSL, MS, SL80

Max Length Total (mm): 80

Mainstream, Rx,Tx, Pre-Channel

Category: Mainstream

Material: None

Signal Group: Rx, Tx

Redriver/Retimer: Pre-Channel

[To be Removed] Type-C TBT+USB+DP 20G Retimer Topology Mainstream, Rx,Tx, Pre-Channel Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)
BODSL, MS, SL8
M1+M2DSL, MS, SL337

Max Length Total (mm): 345

Type-C TBT+USB+DP 40G Cascaded Retimer Topology

Type-C TBT+USB+DP 40G Cascaded Retimer Topology Diagram
Type-C TBT+USB+DP 40G Cascaded Retimer Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Number of vias allowed2 before retimer, 2 between retimers, 2 after retimer.
Maximum via stub length250 um per via between CPU and retimer 1. Post retimer 1 post channel cannot have via stub.
Routing styleMicrostrip main route routing must be interleaved. To reduce system RFI/ EMI, it is recommended to use SL instead of MS. If MS routing is needed, refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a IO rail power plane with Iccmax < 5A that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a IO rail power plane with Iccmax < 5A that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route.
ESDOn-Semi ESDL2012 or ESDL2013. Alternative option: Semtech RClamp1011ZC.
AC cap value135 nF to 265 nF including tolerance. For the post-channel cap - Form factor: 0201 recommended. - Rated voltage: 25 V. For the pre-channel cap - Form factor: 0201 recommended. - Rated voltage: 6.3 V.
Crx cap value297 nF to 363 nF including tolerance. - Form factor: 0201 recommended. - Rated voltage: 25 V.
Rb resistor value220 kΩ ± 5% Form factor: 0201 recommended.
AC return current path capacitors10nF to 22nF including tolerance. For 20v VBUS: 25v DC rated; For 28v VBUS: 35v DC rated; For 35v VBUS: 50v DC rated; For 48v VBUS: 63v DC rated. Please prefer 0201 form factor if possible. Should be placed as close as possible to type-C VBUS and GND pads.
Rc resistor value1 Ω ± 10% - Form factor: 0201 recommended.
TX bleed resistor placeholderRecommend having a placeholder for an 0201 Rb resistor between the AC cap and Type-C connector on the SSTX pairs.
RetimerSupported Topologies: 1. Hayden Bridge (SOC side) + Hayden Bridge (connector side) 2. Hayden Bridge (SOC side) + Gothic Bridge (connector side)
Total insertion loss budget from CPU pins to retimer pins17 dB @ 10 GHz. Inclusive of HVM variation.
Total insertion loss budget from retimer pins to Type-C connector pads4.5 dB @ 10 GHz on PCB. Inclusive of HVM variation. Not inclusive of the connector.
Total insertion loss budget from retimer 1 pins to retimer 2 pins17 dB @ 10 GHz. Inclusive of HVM variation.
Supported interfacesThunderbolt 4.0, USB3.2 Gen2x2, USB4.0 Gen3 and DP2.1 (UHBR20).
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).

Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement

Mainstream, Rx,Tx, Pre-Channel 2

Category: Mainstream

Material: None

Signal Group: Rx, Tx

Redriver/Retimer: Pre-Channel 2

Type-C TBT+USB+DP 40G Cascaded Retimer Topology Mainstream, Rx,Tx, Pre-Channel 2 Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)
M3 + M4MS, DSL, SL205

Max Length Total (mm): 205

Type-C TBT+USB+DP 40G Retimer Internal Cable Topology

Type-C TBT+USB+DP 40G Retimer Internal Cable Topology Diagram
Type-C TBT+USB+DP 40G Retimer Internal Cable Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Number of vias allowed2 before retimer, 2 after retimer.
Maximum via stub length250 um per via between CPU and retimer. Retimer post-channel cannot have via stub.
Routing styleMicrostrip main route routing must be interleaved. To reduce system RFI/ EMI, it is recommended to use SL instead of MS. If MS routing is needed, refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a IO rail power plane with Iccmax < 5A that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a IO rail power plane with Iccmax < 5A that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route.
ESDOn-Semi ESDL2012 or ESDL2013. Alternative option: Semtech RClamp1011ZC.
AC cap value135 nF to 265 nF including tolerance. For the post-channel cap - Form factor: 0201 recommended. - Rated voltage: 25 V. For the pre-channel cap - Form factor: 0201 recommended. - Rated voltage: 6.3 V.
Crx cap value297 nF to 363 nF including tolerance. - Form factor: 0201 recommended. - Rated voltage: 25 V.
Rb resistor value220 kΩ ± 5% Form factor: 0201 recommended.
Rc resistor value1 Ω ± 10% - Form factor: 0201 recommended.
TX bleed resistor placeholderRecommend having a placeholder for an 0201 Rb resistor between the AC cap and Type-C connector on the SSTX pairs.
RetimerHayden Bridge and Gothic Bridge
Cable assemblyRefer to "Ice Lake Platform Laptop TBT Internal Cable and Connector Implementation Document" (#575032).
Total insertion loss budget from CPU pins to retimer pins16 dB @ 10 GHz. Inclusive of HVM variation.
Total insertion loss budget from retimer pins to Type-C connector pads4.5 dB @ 10 GHz on PCB. Inclusive of HVM variation. Not inclusive of the connector.
Supported interfacesThunderbolt 4.0, USB3.2 Gen2x2, USB4.0 Gen3 and DP2.1 (UHBR20).
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).

Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement

NoteDetail
Number of vias allowed2 before retimer, 2 after retimer.
Maximum via stub length250 um per via between CPU and retimer. Retimer post-channel cannot have via stub.
Routing styleMicrostrip main route routing must be interleaved. To reduce system RFI/ EMI, it is recommended to use SL instead of MS. If MS routing is needed, refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a IO rail power plane with Iccmax < 5A that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a IO rail power plane with Iccmax < 5A that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route.

(Internal RVP) Type-C TBT+USB+DP 40G Retimer Topology

Type-C TBT+USB+DP 40G Retimer Topology Diagram
(Internal RVP) Type-C TBT+USB+DP 40G Retimer Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Number of vias allowed2 before retimer, 2 after retimer.
Maximum via stub length250 um per via between CPU and retimer. Retimer post-channel cannot have via stub.
Routing styleMicrostrip main route routing must be interleaved. To reduce system RFI/ EMI, it is recommended to use SL instead of MS. If MS routing is needed, refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a power plane that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a power plane that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route.
ESDOn-Semi ESDL2012 or ESDL2013. Alternative option: Semtech RClamp1011ZC.
AC cap value135 nF to 265 nF including tolerance. For the post-channel cap - Form factor: 0201 recommended. - Rated voltage: 25 V. When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: - Form factor: 0402 recommended. - Rated voltage: 63 V. For the pre-channel cap - Form factor: 0201 recommended. - Rated voltage: 6.3 V.
Crx cap value297 nF to 363 nF including tolerance. - Form factor: 0201 recommended. - Rated voltage: 25 V. When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: - Form factor: 0402 recommended. - Rated voltage: 63 V.
Rb resistor value220 kΩ ± 5% Form factor: 0201 recommended.
Rc resistor value2.2 Ω ± 10% - Form factor: 0201 recommended. When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: i. If EPR is @ 28 V, then Rc should be 2.7 Ω ± 5%. ii. If EPR is @ 36 V, then Rc should be 3.24 Ω ± 5%. iii. If EPR is @ 48 V, then Rc should be 4.02 Ω ± 5%.
TX bleed resistor placeholderRecommend having a placeholder for an 0201 Rb resistor between the AC cap and Type-C connector on the SSTX pairs.
RetimerHayden Bridge
Total insertion loss budget from CPU pins to retimer pins17 dB @ 10 GHz. Inclusive of HVM variation.
Total insertion loss budget from retimer pins to Type-C connector pads4.5 dB @ 10 GHz on PCB. Inclusive of HVM variation. Not inclusive of connector.
Supported interfacesThunderbolt 4.0, USB3.2 Gen2x2, USB4.0 Gen3 and DP2.1 (UHBR20).
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement
Rx, Tx2Pre-Channel
Rx, Tx2Post-Channel

(Internal RVP) Type-C TBT+USB+DP 40G Retimer Internal Cable with Modular M.2 Topology

Type-C TBT+USB+DP 40G Retimer Internal Cable with Modular M.2 Topology Diagram
(Internal RVP) Type-C TBT+USB+DP 40G Retimer Internal Cable with Modular M.2 Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Number of vias allowed2 before retimer on main board, 2 after retimer on modular card.
Maximum via stub length250 um per via between CPU and retimer. Retimer post-channel cannot have via stub.
Routing styleMicrostrip main route routing must be interleaved. To reduce system RFI/ EMI, it is recommended to use SL instead of MS. If MS routing is needed, refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a power plane that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a power plane that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route.
ESDOn-Semi ESDL2012 or ESDL2013. Alternative option: Semtech RClamp1011ZC.
AC cap value135 nF to 265 nF including tolerance. For the post-channel cap - Form factor: 0201 recommended. - Rated voltage: 25 V. When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: - Form factor: 0402 recommended. - Rated voltage: 63 V. For the pre-channel cap - Form factor: 0201 recommended. - Rated voltage: 6.3 V.
Crx cap value297 nF to 363 nF including tolerance. - Form factor: 0201 recommended. - Rated voltage: 25 V. When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: - Form Factor: 0402 recommended. - Rated voltage: 63 V.
Rb resistor value220 kΩ ± 5% Form factor: 0201 recommended.
Rc resistor value2.2 Ω ± 10% - Form factor: 0201 recommended. When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: i. If EPR is @ 28 V, then Rc should be 2.7 Ω ± 5%. ii. If EPR is @ 36V, then Rc should be 3.24 Ω ± 5%. iii. If EPR is @ 48 V, then Rc should be 4.02 Ω ± 5%.
TX bleed resistor placeholderRecommend having a placeholder for an 0201 Rb resistor between the AC cap and Type-C connector on the SSTX pairs.
RetimerHayden Bridge
Cable assemblyRefer to "Ice Lake Platform Laptop TBT Internal Cable and Connector Implementation Document" (#575032).
Total insertion loss budget from CPU pins to retimer pins15.5 dB @ 10 GHz. Inclusive of HVM variation.
Total insertion loss budget from retimer pins to Type-C connector pads4.5 dB @ 10 GHz on PCB. Inclusive of HVM variation. Not inclusive of the connector.
Supported interfacesThunderbolt 4.0, USB3.2 Gen2x2, USB4.0 Gen3 and DP2.1 (UHBR20).
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
M.2 ConnectorEquivalent performance with M.2 Gen5 spec connector or better.

Number of vias allowed2 before retimer on main board, 2 after retimer on modular card.

Reference plane for stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a power plane that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a power plane that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route.

Max Length Total (mm): 235

Max Length Total Note: RVP to route Max Length at Layer Top/L14.

Type-C USB+DP

Type-C USB+DP General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Discrete component part size for mainstream stackup0402, if routing near maximum length it is recommended to use 0201 component size.
Recommended short protection circuitIt is recommended to include this circuit to comply with USB ECN \"RX AC Coupling Capacitor Option\" to provide ESD/ EOS protection and set RX bias at the Type-C connector. Intel's recommendation on DC rating of the Crx is 25 V (Extended Power Range not implemented)/50 V (Extended Power Range implemented). The customer should consider short event to VBUS that can be up to 20 V.
Voiding recommendation for mainstream stackupIt is recommended to void unused (non-functional) pads for differential vias and pin pads for CMCs, ESDs, AC cap and connectors to optimize the impedance matching in the channel.
Unused signalsUnused data and AUX signals should be left as no connect at the BGA ball.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Reference plane Microstrip: Must be continuous ground Stripline: Ground on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a IO rail power plane with Iccmax < 5A that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground. Dual Stripline: Ground on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a IO rail power plane with Iccmax < 5A that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route.
Type-C USB+DP Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.125
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.25
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)Yes25
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)Yes25
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)Yes25
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

(Internal RVP) Type-C USB+DP Main Link with M.2 Modular Topology

Type-C USB+DP Main Link with M.2 Modular Topology Diagram
(Internal RVP) Type-C USB+DP Main Link with M.2 Modular Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Number of vias allowed4 (route within 2 layers).
Maximum via stub length250 um per via.
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground. Prefer ground on both sides.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route. Prefer ground on both sides.
CMCRefer to the EMC Component Selection section of the PDG for CMC recommendation(s)
ESDRefer to the EMC Component Selection section of the PDG for ESD recommendation(s)
AC cap value75 nF to 265 nF including tolerance, 25 V (Extended Power Range not implemented)/ 50 V (Extended Power Range implemented).
Crx cap value297 nF to 363 nF including tolerance, 25 V (Extended Power Range not implemented)/ 50 V (Extended Power Range implemented).
Rb resistor value220 kΩ ± 5%, 25 V (Extended Power Range not implemented)/ 50 V (Extended Power Range implemented).
TX bleed resistor placeholderRecommend having a placeholder for an 0201 Rb resistor between the AC cap and Type-C connector on the SSTX pairs.
Supported interfacesUSB3.2 Gen 2x2 (10 Gbps per lane) and DP v1.4a (up to 8.1 Gbps per lane)
Routing styleMicrostrip main route routing must be interleaved. To reduce system RFI/ EMI, it is recommended to use SL instead of MS. If MS routing is needed, refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.
M.2 ConnectorEquivalent performance with M.2 Gen5 spec connector or better.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement

Type-C USB+DP Main Link Internal Cable Topology

Type-C USB+DP Main Link Internal Cable Topology Diagram
Type-C USB+DP Main Link Internal Cable Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Number of vias allowed4 (route within 2 layers).
Maximum via stub length250 um per via.
CMCRefer to the EMC Component Selection section of the PDG for CMC recommendation(s).
ESDRefer to the EMC Component Selection section of the PDG for ESD recommendation(s).
AC cap value75 nF to 265 nF including tolerance, 25 V (Extended Power Range not implemented)/ 50 V (Extended Power Range implemented).
Crx cap value297 nF to 363 nF including tolerance, 25 V(Extended Power Range not implemented)/ 50 V (Extended Power Range implemented).
Rb resistor value220 kΩ ± 5%, 25 V (Extended Power Range not implemented)/ 50 V (Extended Power Range implemented).
TX bleed resistor placeholderRecommend having a placeholder for an 0201 Rb resistor between the AC cap and Type-C connector on the SSTX pairs.
203 mm cable assembly76-94 Ω including tolerance. Insertion loss ≥ -2.5 dB @ 2.5 GHz, ≥ -3.3 dB @ 5.0 GHz. Crosstalk ≤ -33 dB @ 5-10 GHz.
Supported interfacesUSB3.2 Gen 2x2 (10 Gbps per lane) and DP v1.4a (up to 8.1 Gbps per lane)
Length trade-off for mainstream stackupIf 60 mm < BO+M[1:6] ≤ 85 mm then Mcable ≤ 127 mm.
Routing styleMicrostrip main route routing must be interleaved. To reduce system RFI/ EMI, it is recommended to use SL instead of MS. If MS routing is needed, refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.

Mainstream, Rx,Tx

Type-C USB+DP Main Link Topology Mainstream, Rx,Tx Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)
BODSL, MS, SL8
M1+M2DSL, MS, SL118
M3+M4+M5DSL, MS, SL25

Max Length Total (mm): 118

Type-C USB

Type-C USB General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Discrete component part size for mainstream stackup0402, if routing near maximum length it is recommended to use 0201 component size.
Voiding recommendation for mainstream stackupIt is recommended to void unused (non-functional) pads for differential vias and pin pads for CMCs, ESDs, AC cap and connectors to optimize the impedance matching in the channel.
Unused signalsUnused data and AUX signals should be left no connected at the BGA ball.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Reference planeMicrostrip: Must be continuous ground Stripline: Ground on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a IO rail power plane with Iccmax < 5A that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground. Dual Stripline: Ground on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a IO rail power plane with Iccmax < 5A that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route.
Type-C USB Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.125
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.25
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)No0
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

Gen1x1 Type-A Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Number of vias allowed3 (route within 2 layers).
Maximum via stub length375 um per via.
CMCRefer to the EMC Component Selection section of the PDG for CMC recommendation(s).
ESDRefer to the EMC Component Selection section of the PDG for ESD recommendation(s).
AC cap value75 nF to 265 nF including tolerance, 25 V.
Supported interfacesUSB3.2 Gen1 (5 Gbps)
Routing styleMicrostrip main route routing must be interleaved. To reduce system RFI/ EMI, it is recommended to use SL instead of MS. If MS routing is needed, refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.

Gen2x1 Type-A Redriver Topology Diagram
(Internal Only) Gen2x1 Type-A Redriver Topology Notes
Note
Note1*: Max/ min routing length for USB3.2 Gen1 & 2 speeds (5/ 10 Gbps) depends on redriver performance and its loss compensation capability when used in conjunction with Intel CPU. Work with repeater vendor to ensure the selected part can provide adequate signal integrity at the CPU.

USB2.0

USB2.0 General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Refer to USB 2.0 DCR ECN for D+ and D- maximum series DC resistance (DCR) specification.
Reference PlaneMicrostrip: Must be continuous ground Stripline: Ground on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a IO rail power plane with Iccmax < 5A that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground. Dual Stripline: Ground on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a IO rail power plane with Iccmax < 5A that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route.
USB2.0 Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.381
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.254
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)No0
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

M8Trace1719
TYPE-C CONNECTERDevice18-1
TYPE-C CONNECTER-1Device19-1

USB3.2

Description: This PHY only supports configuration with standard Type-A connector.

USB3.2 Stub Requirement
USB3.2 Component Routing Requirement
USB3.2 Component Pad Voiding Requirement
USB3.2 Receptacle Ground Void Dimension Recommendations
USB3.2 Signals to PTH Transition Requirement
USB3.2 General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Length matching between P and N within a diff. pairWithin same layer mismatch < 0.254 mm. Total length mismatch < 0.127 mm.
Stub requirementChannel and via stub requirement must meet < 381 um for both Tx and Rx signal pairs.
Tx AC cap value for USB3.2 Gen1 & Gen2AC capacitor value: 100 nF nominal (75 nF - 265 nF range).
Short circuit protection for Type-C topology (if applicable)Crx cap value: 297 nF to 363 nF including tolerance, 25 V. Rb resistor value: 220 kΩ ± 5%.
Component size requirement ( CMC, ESD, AC cap, Resistor)Strongly recommended to use 0201 components for better impedance control.
Component voidingAll component pads must be voided on L2 and with GND reference on L3. Suggest having pad voiding size of 50.8 um (2 mils) overcut. Refer to Component Pad Voiding diagram.
Component routingSignal pair to entry/ exist from components pad symmetrically. Maintain differential routing to meet trace target impedance whenever possible.
Signal PTH/ via transitionDifferential pair voiding needed for each signal pair transition with recommended antipad size of 0.75 mm. Suggest having two symmetrical GND stitching vias for each signal pair transition.
Cable and connector recommendationStrongly recommended to use SMT connectors. For PTH connectors (assuming connector is on the top), USB3.2 signals need to be routed from the bottom of the board such that there is no stub on for connector entry. Intel strongly recommends selecting cables and connectors which meet electrical requirements specified in both USB-IF Cable and Connector Specification dated June 2017 and Universal Serial Bus 3.1 Legacy Connectors and Cable Assemblies Compliance dated April 2018. The USB-IF does not certify legacy or USB Type-C(tm) Gen2 stacked connectors. The USB-IF does certify legacy or USB Type-C(tm) Gen1 stacked connectors. Refer USB-IF for more details.
PTH connector voiding requirementDifferential oval antipad required for all layers. Suggest using differential signal antipad with 2 mm size.
Repeater pad voidingA differential void on L2 that is larger than the repeater with 50.8 um (2 mils) overcut is recommended. GND referencing is needed on L3. Refer to Component Pad Voiding diagram.
Routing schemeNon-interleaved breakout (B0) is required to mitigate near-end crosstalk. The main route (MR) supports both interleaved routing and non-interleaved routing for maximum flexibility on stripline (SL). For microstrip (MS), interleaved routing scheme is recommended.
Reference planeContinuous GND is recommended. If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). IO power rails with less than 5A max current can be considered for dual reference implementation. If non-continuous power referencing is unavoidable on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt), but stitching caps are required over each plane split and need to be placed within 6 mm of a signal running across the plane split.
USB3.2 Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.127
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.254
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)No0
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

CSI CPHY

CPHY_cable_guidelines
CSI CPHY General Guidelines
NoteDetail
CPHY configuration routing recommendation Recommend each CPHY port to be routed on the same layer.
Common mode choke (CMC)Need is platform/ sensor specific and should be located near sensor. CMC not accounted for in PDG.
Trio length matching125 um for each trio; 1 mm between trios of a port
Trio routing arrangementAll trios should be routed as A-B-C or C-B-A
Referencing considerationNo routing over split planes allowed, or routing over noisy power planes. Only routing over solid planes are permissible. MIPI CSI CPHY signals should be treated as single ended nets.
Via placementVia placement must be uniform within a trio to enable unform routing and transition. During each via transition, it is imperative that return vias are placed symmetrically close to the data vias. Ensure minimal routing imbalances when traces are routed in/out from the via to reduce impedance imbalance i.e uniformity of spacing between wire A,B and C.
CSI port use preferenceIf some of the CSI ports are not used, it must have CSI_A as one of the used ports.
Loss numbers 1. PCB Loss number assumed: -0.42dB/inch (worst case) at 1.25 GHz 2. FPC cable loss number assumed: -0.316dB/inch (worst case) at 1.25 GHz 3. Cable length guideline is based on FPC cable. FPC cable loss should be within the loss number specified above. If micro-Coax is used, cable length can be longer as micro-Coax loss. Ex. 40 AWG cable has loss: -0.15dB/inch at 1.25 GHz. Please note that Cable loss numbers are general guidelines and actual numbers may be different due to the dimensions, type of material used. (Refer to the individual topologies for total loss numbers). These loss number take precedence over length mentioned in individual topologies below specially while using lower loss cable options like micro coaxial cables.
Reference planeMicrostrip: Full Ground reference Stripline: Ground on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a IO rail power plane with Iccmax < 5A that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground.
PCB and Cable length restrictionFor both PCB and Cables, length can be 20%-80% of maximum length unless specified otherwise. This guideline doesn't apply in case cable is absent.
General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Cable assembly impedance50 ohms +/- 10% for single ended
Cable assembly Insertion Loss> -0.72 dB/inch; single ended; up to 1.25 Ghz
Cable assembly Return Loss< -28 dB total; single ended; up to 1.25 Ghz
Cable assembly Near end Crosstalk< -25 dB total; single ended; up to 1.25 Ghz
Cable assembly Far end Crosstalk< -26 dB total; single ended; up to 1.25 Ghz
Cable only impedance50 ohms +/- 10% for single ended
Cable only Insertion Loss> -0.041 dB/inch; single ended; up to 1.25 Ghz
Cable only Return Loss< -50 dB total; single ended; up to 1.25 Ghz
Cable only Near end Crosstalk< -55 dB total; single ended; up to 1.25 Ghz
Cable only Far end Crosstalk< -63 dB total; single ended; up to 1.25 Ghz
CSI CPHY Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequired
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)No
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)No
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)No
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)No
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No

Total insertion loss (BO1+M1+M2+Mcable)For ≤ 1.0 Gsps: up to -10 dB @1.25 GHz.
Supported stackupsCSI CPHY is supported only on 10L T3 and 10L T4 stackups

PTL H12Xe/H484: CSI CPHY Main Link Up To 2.0 Gsps Topology

CSI CPHY Main Link Up To 2.0 Gsps Topology Diagram
PTL H12Xe/H484: CSI CPHY Main Link Up To 2.0 Gsps Topology Notes
NoteDetail

UFS

Description: (Internal Validation)

UFS General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Stub requirementChannel and via stub requirement must meet < 254 um for both Tx and Rx signal pairs.
Component size requirement ( CMC)Strongly recommended to use 0201 components for better impedance control.
Component voidingAll component pads must be voided on L2 and with GND reference on L3. Suggest having pad voiding size of 50.8 um (2 mils) overcut. Refer to Component Pad Voiding diagram.
Component routingSignal pair to entry/ exist from components pad symmetrically. Maintain differential routing to meet trace target impedance whenever possible.
Signal PTH/ via transitionDifferential pair voiding needed for each signal pair transition with recommended antipad size of 0.75 mm. Suggest having two symmetrical GND stitching vias for each signal pair transition.
Routing schemeNon-interleaved breakout (B0) is required to mitigate near-end crosstalk. The main route (MR) supports both interleaved routing and non-interleaved routing for maximum flexibility on stripline (SL). For microstrip (MS), interleaved routing scheme is recommended.
Reference planeMicrostrip: Must be continuous ground Stripline: Ground on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a IO rail power plane with Iccmax < 5A that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground. Dual Stripline: Ground on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a IO rail power plane with Iccmax < 5A that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route.
UFS Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.127
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.254
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)Yes12.7
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)Yes12.7
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

(Internal Validation) UFS Device Down Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Breakout length and spacingAn initial breakout segment of 4 mm in length with a tighter pair-to-pair spacing of 0.11 mm - 0.16 mm is allowed.

CLINK

CLINK 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology

CLINK 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology Diagram
CLINK 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Maximum trace DC resistance 14 Ω
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals25.4 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.125 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
Signal name/ listCL_CLK, CL_DATA, CL_RST#.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement
Rx5Total Channel
Tx5Total Channel

Signal Group: Rx-Tx

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartEnd
CPUDevice01
BOTrace12
M1Trace23
CONNECTORDevice3-1

Segment Lengths

CLINK 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology Segment Lengths Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)Max Length Segment Note
BODSL, MS, SL12.7
M1DSL, MS, SL241.3
M2DSL, MS, SL38.1

CNVi BRI and RGI

CNVi BRI and RGI 1-Load Topology

CNVi BRI and RGI 1-Load M.2 Connector Topology Diagram
CNVi BRI and RGI 1-Load Module Down Topology Diagram
CNVi BRI and RGI 1-Load Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Max frequency40 MHz
M4 (BRI_RSP)For microstrip and stripline routing only on platform, the total main board trace length can be extended up to 253.7 mm. For that, it is recommended to implement M4 < 228.3 mm (max).
Reference plane(1) Continuous GND is recommended for microstrip line. (2) Dual continuous GND is recommended for strip line. (3) If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). (4) If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
R110 Ω for max total length ≥ 76.2mm. 15 Ω for max total length < 76.2mm. To be placed 12.7 mm (can be extended to 25.4 mm) from the CPU for CNV_BRI_DT and CNV_RGI_DT signal.
R2 (RGI)For Wi-Fi 6E AX211, Wi-Fi 7 BE201, Wi-Fi 7 BE211 and Wi-Fi 7 BE213; [1] 30 Ω ± 5% for max total length ≥ 76.2mm. [2] 36 Ω ± 5% for max total length < 76.2mm. To be placed 12.7 mm from the connector for CNV_RGI_RSP signal.
R2 (BRI)For Wi-Fi 6E AX211, Wi-Fi 7 BE211, and Wi-Fi 7 BE213; [1] 30 Ω ± 5% for max total length ≥ 76.2 mm. [2] 36 Ω ± 5% for max total length < 76.2 mm. For Wi-Fi 7 BE201; [1] 5 Ω ± 5% for max total length ≥ 76.2 mm on Type 3 8L Mainstream, Mid Loss (ML) and Type 3 10L Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML) Stackup. [2] 10 Ω ± 5% for max total length ≥ 76.2 mm on Type 4 10L Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML) Stackup. [3] 36 Ω ± 5% for max total length < 76.2 mm on Type 3 8L Mainstream, Mid Loss (ML), Type 3 10L Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML) and Type 4 10L Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML) Stackup. To be placed 12.7 mm from the connector for CNV_BRI_RSP signal.
Length restriction for full Dual Stripline routingM1 + M2 = 63.5 mm (max). M3 + M4 = 63.5 mm (max).
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.250 mm
Signal name/ listCNV_BRI_DT, CNV_RGI_DT, CNV_BRI_RSP, CNV_RGI_RSP.

M5MS, DSL, SL12.7

Max Length Total (mm): 177.8

Max Length Total Note: For routing involving DSL, it need to limit to 177.8 mm max total length. For routing with MS and SL, it can be extended up to 253.7 mm max total length.

CPU GPIO

CPU GPIO CMOS Buffer Type Topology

CPU GPIO 1-Load Topology Diagram
CPU GPIO Multi-Load Branch Topology Diagram
Formula for Strapping or Pull-up Resistor Calculation
Example of Strapping or Pull-up Resistor Calculation
CPU GPIO CMOS Buffer Type Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Total trace lengthTotal trace length options as below: [1] Total trace length BO + M1 + BI =< 177.8 mm, or [2] Total trace length BO + M2 + BI =< 177.8 mm, or [3] Total trace length BO + Mn + BI =< 177.8 mm.
Strapping resistor, R_strap20 kΩ on need basis, for strapping purposes. Resistor can be either pull-up or pull-down depending on strapping design.
Number of vias allowedNo restriction.
Reference planeNo restriction.
Note 1R_strap resistor is optional depending on signal needs and can be anywhere along M1, M2, Mn lane. Refer to EDS or device datasheet for the requirement.
Note 2Main route of Mn can start anywhere along M1 as long as the total length of each branch from CPU to device is less than 177.8 mm.
Note 3R_strap resistor value depends on power sequence/ strapping's timing and DC voltage level requirement (refer below for calculation details).
Note 4Level shifter may be needed depending on actual device implementation. Generally no length restriction after level shifter.
Note 5For CPU input-only signal, if device output is open drain buffer type, then proper pull-up resistor, Rpu is needed and refer to "Rise Time and R_strap or Rpu Calculation" section for details.
Note 6Noise sensitive GPIO pin should be properly shielded/ with sufficient trace spacing (e.g.: 3x of trace width). This is to prevent undesirable random system reset. Examples of signal: PMU_PLTRST_B, FORCEPR#.
Rise time and R_strap or Rpu calculation
R_strap or Rpu formulaRefer image [Formula for Strapping or Pull-up Resistor].
Bus capacitance rule of thumb, CbDevice = 10 pF per device. Board trace = 3.3 pF per 25.4 mm of trace length.
Example[1] Total bus length = 10 inches --> 10 x 3.3 pF = 33 pF. [2] Branch topology with two devices --> 2 x 10 pF = 20 pF. [3] With a rise time requirement (tr) = 1 us. Refer image [Example for Strapping or Pull-up Resistor Calculation].

Segment Lengths

CPU GPIO CMOS Buffer Type Topology Segment Lengths Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)
BOMS, DSL, SL12.7
M1MS, DSL, SL177.6
BIMS, DSL, SL12.7

Max Length Total (mm): 203

[For Internal Reference] GPIO Open Drain Buffer Type Topology

Description: Note: For internal reference only! Do not publish in external PDG!

Formula for Strapping or Pull-up Resistor Calculation
Example for Strapping or Pull-up Resistor Calculation
[For Internal Reference] GPIO Open Drain Buffer Type Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Note 1No length/ topology restriction.
Note 2Pull-up resistor, Rpu can be calculated based on rise time requirement (refer to "Rise time and R_strap or Rpu calculation" section for details). Rise time requirement may varies depending on device requirement (if any), refer to device data sheet.
Note 3Intel input buffer does not have any rise/ fall time requirement. For device TX open drain signal, refer to device's design guide or Intel reference schematic for pull-up resistor value.
Rise time and R_strap or Rpu calculation
R_strap or Rpu formulaRefer image [Formula for Strapping or Pull-up Resistor].
Bus capacitance rule of thumb, CbDevice = 10 pF per device. Board trace = 3.3 pF per 25.4 mm of trace length.
Example[1] Total bus length = 10 inches --> 10 x 3.3 pF = 33 pF. [2] Branch topology with two devices --> 2 x 10 pF = 20 pF. [3] With a rise time requirement (tr) = 1 us. Refer image [Example for Strapping or Pull-up Resistor Calculation].

DMIC

DMIC 2-Load Branch Topology

DMIC 2-Load Branch CLK Topology Diagram
DMIC 2-Load Branch DATA Topology Diagram
DMIC 2-Load Branch Topology Notes
NoteDetail
R1 & C1[1] EMI RC filter placeholder: Stuff R1 with 0 Ω and unstuff C1 by default. Refer to EMC section for details. [2] To be placed only for DMIC_CLK. [3] C1 is recommended to be placed close to R1. C1 is recommended to be placed 12.7 mm from the CPU, but can be extended to 25.4 mm maximum if required. The length of breakout section (BO) is still 12.7 mm maximum. If M1 is routed on MS, EMI RC filter should be placed at the beginning of the MS routing.
R250 Ω. [1] R2 is recommended to be placed immediate after the branches. [2] If the branches not immediately split after connector, please follow rule [1].
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Length matching between branchBranch 1 and branch 2 need to be length matched within 2.54 mm.
Length matching between CLK and DATA signalsN/A
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.125 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
CPU buffer driver strength[1] GPP_D: 40 Ω. [2] GPP_S: 50 Ω, slew 11.
Signal name/ listDMIC_CLK_A[0:1], DMIC_DATA[0:1].
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement
Tx7Total Channel
Rx7Total Channel

Signal Group: Tx

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartEnd
CPUDevice01
BOTrace12
R1Resistor23
R1Resistor24
M1Trace35
C1Capacitor46
CONNECTORDevice5-1
GNDGround6-1

Signal Group: Rx

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartEnd
CPUDevice01
BOTrace12
M1Trace23
CONNECTORDevice3-1

Segment Lengths

DMIC 2-Load Branch Topology Segment Lengths Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)
BODSL, MS, SL12.7
M1DSL, MS, SL254
M2DSL, MS, SL127
M_cableCable508

Max Length Total (mm): 901.7

Max Length Total Note: 1) Max length between CPU to the furthest end device = 901.7 mm;​ 2) Total topology length = 1028.7 mm.

DMIC 2-Load Daisy Topology

DMIC 2-Load Daisy CLK Topology Diagram
DMIC 2-Load Daisy DATA Topology Diagram
DMIC 2-Load Daisy Topology Notes
NoteDetail
R1 & C1[1] EMI RC filter placeholder: Stuff R1 with 0 Ω and unstuff C1 by default. Refer to EMC section for details. [2] To be placed only for DMIC_CLK. [3] C1 is recommended to be placed close to R1. C1 is recommended to be placed 12.7 mm from the CPU, but can be extended to 25.4 mm maximum if required. The length of breakout section (BO) is still 12.7 mm maximum. If M1 is routed on MS, EMI RC filter should be placed at the beginning of the MS routing.
R250 Ω. R2 is recommended to be placed immediate after the branches from connector.
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Length matching between CLK and DATA signalsN/A
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.125 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
CPU buffer driver strength[1] GPP_D: 40 Ω. [2] GPP_S: 50 Ω, slew 11.
Signal name/ listDMIC_CLK_A[0:1], DMIC_DATA[0:1].

[For Internal Validation] eSPI 2-Load Branch (Device Down) Topology

eSPI 2-Load (Device Down) Topology Diagram
[For Internal Validation] eSPI 2-Load Branch (Device Down) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Reference planeContinuous ground only.
Max frequencyDevice 1: EC at 50 MHz. Device 2: SIO/ TPM at 33 MHz.
Device assumptionCompliant to Intel ESPI base specification 1.0 (66 MHz and above).
R10 Ω for ESPI_CLK and ESPI_IO[0:3].
R20 Ω for ESPI_CLK and ESPI_IO[0:3].
R3100 Ω for ESPI_CLK and ESPI_IO[0:3].
M5 segmentIt is recommended to have SL routing for better SI performance. If MS is requires, please ensure the ratio of MS:SL is 1:1.
Minimum length, total50.8 mm
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals12.7 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.125 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
Signal name/ listESPI_CLK, ESPI_IO[0:3], ESPI_CS[0:1]#, ESPI_ALERT[0:1]#, ESPI_RESET#.
DATA routing requirements (For 50MHz at 190.5mm maximum length)DATA must be routed in between DATA & Pseudo Static Signals, by following this approach, TS can be 125um. Min. Length for SL routing need to meet 50.8mm.
CLK routing requirements (For 50MHz at 190.5mm maximum length)CLK can be routed in between DATA & Pseudo Static Signals, by following this approach, TS can be 375um. Min. Length for SL routing need to meet 50.8mm.
Routing Layers RecommendationsBO, M1, M2, M3, M4, M5, M6, M7 and M8 should be route on MS or SL only.
Routing Length Ratio RecommendationsRatio between MS:SL should not be more than 70:30 where 70% of total length routed on MS will be the maximum allowable length.
Topology maximum lengthThis topology approach was designed to meet route length of the eSPI for 50MHz path at 190.5mm and 33MHz path at 215.9mm that was requested and agreed between SI and RVP Team

Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement

NoteDetail

M5 segmentIt is recommended to have SL routing for better SI performance. If MS is requires, please ensure the ratio of MS:SL is 1:1.
Minimum length, total50.8 mm
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals12.7 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.125 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
Signal name/ listESPI_CLK, ESPI_IO[0:3], ESPI_CS[0:1]#, ESPI_ALERT[0:1]#, ESPI_RESET#.
Topology maximum lengthThis topology approach was designed to meet route length of the eSPI for 50MHz path at 190.5mm and 33MHz path at 215.9mm that was requested and agreed between SI and RVP Team
Routing Length Ratio RecommendationsRatio between MS:SL should not be more than 70:30 where 70% of total length routed on MS will be the maximum allowable length.
DATA routing requirements (For 50MHz at 190.5mm maximum length)DATA must be routed in between DATA & Pseudo Static Signals, by following this approach, TS can be 125um. Min. Length for SL routing need to meet 50.8mm.
CLK routing requirements (For 50MHz at 190.5mm maximum length)CLK can be routed in between DATA & Pseudo Static Signals, by following this approach, TS can be 375um. Min. Length for SL routing need to meet 50.8mm.
Routing Layers RecommendationsBO, M1, M2, M3, M4, M5, M6, M7 and M8 should be route on MS or SL only.

GSPI

GSPI 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology

GSPI 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology Diagram
GSPI 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Reference plane(1) Continuous GND is recommended. (2) If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). (3) If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Max frequency25 MHz
R10 Ω (placeholder). To be placed on GSPI[0:1]_CLK, GSPI[0:1]_MOSI, GSPI[0:1]_MISO, GSPI0A_CLK, GSPI0A_MOSI, GSPI0A_MISO.
M2Can support up to 190.5 mm but the bus frequency needs to reduce to 20 MHz.
Minimum lengthBO + M1 + M2: 63.5 mm.
Device AC timing characteristics Data input setup time < 9 ns. Data input hold time < 5 ns. 0 ns < CLK to DATA output valid time < 14 ns.
Device driver strength characteristics Impedance: 50 Ω to 100 Ω. 0.85 ns < rise/ fall time measured at 20%-80% < 1.9 ns based on 10 pF test load. 1.6 pF ≤ input capacitance, Cin ≤ 1.75 pF.
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals12.7 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.125 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
CPU buffer driver strength50 Ω.
Signal name/ listGSPI[0:1]_CLK, GSPI[0:1]_MISO, GSPI[0:1]_MOSI, GSPI[0:1]_CS0#, GSPI0A_CLK, GSPI0A_MOSI, GSPI0A_MISO, GSPI0A_CS0#.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement
Tx7Total Channel
Rx7Total Channel

Signal Group: Rx, Tx

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartEnd
CPUDevice01
BOTrace12
M1Trace23

M2Trace45

NoteDetail
Reference plane(1) Continuous GND is recommended. (2) If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). (3) If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Max frequency12 MHz
R110 Ω ± 5%. To be placed 12.7 mm from the connector on GSPI[0:1]_CLK, GSPI[0:1]_MOSI, GSPI[0:1]_MISO, GSPI0A_CLK, GSPI0A_MOSI, GSPI0A_MISO.

Imaging Clock 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Device duty cycle specInput clock duty cycle spec of ± 10% or above (example: ± 15%). Refer to vendor's datasheet for the device electrical spec. If the information is not published in the device datasheet, do contact the device vendor for more details.
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
R110 Ω ± 5%. Recommended to be placed 25.4mm from the CPU.
Max Length SegmentMax segment length for M1, M2 and M_cable are interchangeable as long as total max length M1 + M2 + M_cable is < 393.7 mm.

ISH-SPI 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology Diagram
ISH-SPI 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Max frequency25 MHz
R1[1] 100 Ω ± 10%. Recommended to be placed 12.7 mm from the CPU for total length < 127 mm. [2] 36 Ω ± 5% Recommended to be placed 12.7 mm from the CPU for total length ≥ 127 mm. To be placed on ISH_SPI_CLK, ISH_SPI_MOSI and ISH_SPIA_CLK, ISH_SPIA_MOSI
Minimum lengthM2: 12.7 mm
Device AC timing characteristics Data input setup time < 5 ns. Data input hold time < 5 ns. 1 ns < CLK to DATA output valid time < 15 ns.
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals12.7 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.125 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
CPU buffer driver strength50 Ω.
Signal name/ listISH_SPI_CLK, ISH_SPI_MISO, ISH_SPI_MOSI, ISH_SPI_CS#, ISH_SPIA_CLK, ISH_SPIA_MISO, ISH_SPIA_MOSI, ISH_SPIA_CS#.
DATA routing requirementsMISO signal routed in between MOSI & CS# with Trace Spacing=125um
CLK routing requirementCLK signal routed in between CS# and other DATA signal with Trace Spacing=375um.

I2C

I2C General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Note 1Multiple options for pull-up/ pull-down and current assist strengths are provided for a particular total bus capacitance. Choose the optimal value for system based on design considerations like power, BOM and cost.
Note 2Trace capacitance per inch is approximately CL = 85√єr / Zo pF, єr - dielectric constant of material, Zo - trace impedance.
Note 3Bus capacitance calculation assumptions: [1] Device capacitance = 5 pF to 10 pF per I2C device. [2] Motherboard board trace capacitance = 2 pF to 5 pF per inch of trace length. [3] CPU pin capacitance = 8 pF to 10 pF.

I2C Topology

I2C Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Stackup layer (microstrip/ stripline/ dual stripline)MS/ SL/ DSL.
Characteristic impedance30 Ω to 70 Ω.
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Trace spacing between SCL and other signals [1] 0.375 mm: Frequency of other signals > 1 GHz. [2] 0.250 mm: Frequency of other signals > 100 MHz. [3] 0.125 mm: Frequency of other signals ≤ 100 MHz.
Trace spacing between SDA and other signals0.125 mm
Trace segment lengthRefer to bus capacitance table.
Total trace length (SDA, SCL)Individual trace lengths should meet total bus capacitance (Cb) requirements for the mode of operation. Refer to the pull-up/ pull-down tables for the supported bus capacitance.
Length matching between SDA and SCL signals25.4 mm
Pull-up resistor placementNo restriction.
Pull-up resistor value tolerance± 5%
Max stub length to pull-up resistor25.4 mm
Board trace characteristic assumptions for default pull-up recommendationBoard trace resistance per length = 20 Ω per meter. Board trace capacitance per length = 208 pF per meter.
Extended length supportFor extended length support, refer to "813278_PTL-UH_I2C_SMBUS_SMLINK_LSIO_Flexi_PDG". Potential enablers: [1] Reduced trace resistance. [2] Reduced trace capacitance. [3] Optimized pull-up resistor placement.
Signal name/ listI2C[0:5]_SDA, I2C[0:5]_SCL, I2C[2A:5A]_SDA, I2C[2A:5A]_SCL, ISH_I2C[0:2]_SDA, ISH_I2C[0:2]_SCL, ISH_I2C2A_SDA, ISH_I2C2A_SCL.

I2C Standard Mode (100 kHz)

Frequency: 100 kHz

I2C Standard Mode (100 kHz) Settings
Total Bus Capacitance (Cb)External Pull-up StrengthIntel Silicon Pull-down Strength
Up to 50 pF8.2 kΩ100 Ω
Up to 100 pF4.7 kΩ100 Ω
Up to 200 pF2.2 kΩ100 Ω
Up to 300 pF1.5 kΩ100 Ω
Up to 400 pF1.2 kΩ100 Ω

Frequency: 400 kHz

I2C Fast Mode (400 kHz) Settings
Total Bus Capacitance (Cb)External Pull-up StrengthIntel Silicon Pull-down Strength
Up to 50 pF3.3 kΩ100 Ω
Up to 100 pF1.5 kΩ100 Ω
70 pF to 200 pF820 Ω100 Ω
70 pF to 400 pF620 Ω100 Ω

Frequency: 1 MHz

Total Bus Capacitance (Cb)External Pull-up StrengthIntel Silicon Pull-down Strength
Up to 50 pF1.2 kΩ100 Ω
Up to 100 pF680 Ω100 Ω
60 pF to 300 pF300 Ω50 Ω

45 pF to 80 pF1 kΩ100 ΩNone

Up to 100 pF1.2 kΩ100 Ω
85 pF to 240 pF430 Ω50 Ω

I2C High Speed Mode (3.4 MHz) - SCL

Frequency: 3.4 MHz

I2C High Speed Mode (3.4 MHz) - SCL Settings
Total Bus Capacitance (Cb)External Pull-up StrengthIntel Silicon Pull-down StrengthCurrent Assist
Up to 50 pF750 Ω100 ΩNone
45 pF to 75 pF510 Ω100 ΩNone
70 pF to 95 pF620 Ω100 Ω001
90 pF to 100 pF910 Ω100 Ω010

I2C High Speed Mode (3.4 MHz) - SDA

Frequency: 3.4 MHz

I2C High Speed Mode (3.4 MHz) - SDA Settings
Total Bus Capacitance (Cb)External Pull-up StrengthIntel Silicon Pull-down StrengthCurrent Assist
Up to 50 pF1.5 kΩ100 ΩNone
45 pF to 75 pF1 kΩ100 ΩNone
60 pF to 100 pF680 Ω100 ΩNone

I2C for DDR5 SPD Topology

I2C for DDR5 SPD Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Stackup layer (microstrip/ stripline/ dual stripline)MS/ SL/ DSL.
Characteristic impedance30 Ω to 70 Ω.
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Trace spacing between SCL and other signals [1] 0.375 mm: Frequency of other signals > 1 GHz. [2] 0.250 mm: Frequency of other signals > 100 MHz. [3] 0.125 mm: Frequency of other signals ≤ 100 MHz.
Trace spacing between SDA and other signals0.125 mm
Trace segment lengthRefer to bus capacitance table.
Total trace length (SDA, SCL)Individual trace lengths should meet total bus capacitance (Cb) requirements for the mode of operation. Refer to the pull-up/ pull-down tables for the supported bus capacitance.
Length matching between SDA and SCL signals25.4 mm
Pull-up resistor placementNo restriction.
Pull-up resistor value tolerance± 5%
Max stub length to pull-up resistor25.4 mm
Max stub length to device127 mm
Board trace characteristic assumptions for default pull-up recommendationBoard trace resistance per length = 20 Ω per meter. Board trace capacitance per length = 208 pF per meter.
Extended length supportFor extended length support, refer to "813278_PTL-UH_I2C_SMBUS_SMLINK_LSIO_Flexi_PDG". Potential enablers: [1] Reduced trace resistance. [2] Reduced trace capacitance. [3] Optimized pull-up resistor placement.
Max SPD device input capacitance5 pF
General recommendations for DDR5 SPD[1] It is recommended to have a dedicated bus for DDR5 SPD usage. [2] If dedicated bus is not possible, it is recommended to use a voltage translator to shift the signal down to 1V to match the SPD device.
Signal name/ listI2C[0:5]_SDA, I2C[0:5]_SCL, I2C[2A:5A]_SDA, I2C[2A:5A]_SCL, ISH_I2C[0:2]_SDA, ISH_I2C[0:2]_SCL, ISH_I2C2A_SDA, ISH_I2C2A_SCL.

I2C Standard Mode (100 kHz)

Frequency: 100 kHz

I2C Standard Mode (100 kHz) Settings
Total Bus Capacitance (Cb)External Pull-up StrengthIntel Silicon Pull-down Strength
Up to 50 pF8.2 kΩ100 Ω
Up to 100 pF4.7 kΩ100 Ω
Up to 200 pF2.7 kΩ100 Ω
Up to 300 pF1.8 kΩ100 Ω
Up to 400 pF1.5 kΩ50 Ω

I2C Fast Mode (400 kHz)

Frequency: 400 kHz

I2C Fast Mode (400 kHz) Settings
Total Bus Capacitance (Cb)External Pull-up StrengthIntel Silicon Pull-down Strength
Up to 50 pF3.9 kΩ100 Ω
45 pF to 100 pF2.7 kΩ100 Ω
85 pF to 250 pF1.2 kΩ50 Ω

I2C Fast Mode Plus (1 MHz)

Frequency: 1 MHz

I2C Fast Mode Plus (1 MHz) Settings
Total Bus Capacitance (Cb)External Pull-up StrengthIntel Silicon Pull-down Strength
Up to 50 pF2.2 kΩ100 Ω
Up to 115 pF1 kΩ50 Ω

I2S

I2S General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Host/ device mode terminologyHost Mode refers to the mode where the clock is driven by Intel CPU. Device Mode refers to the mode where the clock is driven by external device.

I2S Host Mode: 1-Load (Device Down) Topology

I2S Host Mode: 1-Load (Device Down) Topology Diagram
I2S Host Mode: 1-Load (Device Down) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
R10 Ω placeholder. Recommended to be placed 25.4 mm from CPU, but can be extended to 50.8 mm maximum if required. The length of breakout section (BO) is still 12.7 mm maximum.
R222 Ω. Recommended to be placed 12.7 mm from device.
Max frequency12.288 MHz
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Device AC timing characteristics Data input setup time < 10 ns. Data input hold time < 10 ns. 0 ns < CLK to DATA output valid time < 30 ns.
Minimum length, totalBO + M1: 50.8 mm. BO + M2 + M3: 50.8 mm.
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals12.7 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.125 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
Trace spacing between port to port0.375 mm
CPU buffer driver strength[1] GPP_D (I2S0): 50 Ω. [2] GPP_S (I2S1/ I2S2): 50 Ω, slew 11.
Signal name/ listI2S[0:2]_SCLK, I2S[0:2]_SFRM, I2S[0:2]_TXD, I2S[0:2]_RXD.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement
Rx, Tx7Total Channel
Tx7Total Channel
Rx7Total Channel

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartEnd

R1Resistor23
M1Trace34

M1DSL, MS, SL368.3

I2S Host Mode: 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology

I2S Host Mode: 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology Diagram
I2S Signal Ganging with CNVi GPIO Topology Diagram
I2S Host Mode: 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
R10 Ω placeholder. Recommended to be placed 25.4 mm from CPU, but can be extended to 50.8 mm maximum if required. The length of breakout section (BO) is still 12.7 mm maximum.
R222 Ω. Recommended to be placed 12.7 mm from connector/ header.
R3 (applicable to I2S to discrete CNV module topology only)1k Ω. Used for ganging I2S signals with CNVi GPIO signals. Required on the CNVi GPIO signals, to be placed <2" from the ganging point.
Additional guidelines for I2S to discrete CNV module topology[1] For I2S topology connecting to discrete connectivity module, there is a requirement to share/ gang I2S signals with CNVi GPIO signals (RF_RESET_B and CLKREQ) onto the same physical line: - I2S_SFRM with RF_RESET_B - I2S_TXD with CLKREQ [2] A 1k Ω resistor (R3) is required on the CNVi GPIO signals, to be placed <2" from the ganging point. [3] Location of the ganging is not restricted and can be implemented anywhere along the bus. [4] Refer to "I2S signal ganging with CNVi GPIO" diagram for guidance on the implementation. Note that the I2S series resistors (R1 and R2) are still needed and considered in a separate topology diagram.
Max frequency12.288 MHz
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Device AC timing characteristics Data input setup time < 10 ns. Data input hold time < 10 ns. 0 ns < CLK to DATA output valid time < 30 ns.
Minimum length, totalBO + M1: 50.8 mm. BO + M2 + M3: 50.8 mm.
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals12.7 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.125 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
Trace spacing between port to port0.375 mm
CPU buffer driver strength[1] GPP_D (I2S0): 50 Ω. [2] GPP_S (I2S1/ I2S2): 50 Ω, slew 11.
Signal name/ listI2S[0:2]_SCLK, I2S[0:2]_SFRM, I2S[0:2]_TXD, I2S[0:2]_RXD.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement
Rx, Tx7Total Channel
Tx7Total Channel
Rx7Total Channel

Signal Group: Tx

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartEnd
CPUDevice01

R1Resistor23
M1Trace34
ConnectorDevice4-1

M4MS, DSL, SL12.7
M5MS, DSL, SLDenotes length of the ganging CNVI GPIO signal for I2S discrete connectivity topology. There is no max length restriction for this segment.

NoteDetail
R1[1] 0 Ω for max total length > 406.4 mm. [2] 10 Ω ± 5% for max total length <= 406.4mm. Recommended to be placed 25.4 mm from CPU, but can be extended to 50.8 mm maximum if required. The length of breakout section (BO) is still 12.7 mm maximum.

Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Device AC timing characteristics Data input setup time < 10 ns. Data input hold time < 10 ns. 0 ns < CLK to DATA output valid time < 30 ns.
Minimum length, totalBO + M1 + M_cable + M2: 50.8 mm. BO + M1 + M_cable + M3 + M4: 50.8 mm.
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals12.7 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.125 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
Trace spacing between port to port0.375 mm

I3C

I3C 1-Island (Device Down) Topology

I3C 1-Island (Device Down) Topology Diagram
I3C 1-Island (Device Down) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Mixed bus topologyThis topology supports usages with a mix of I2C and I3C devices. For mixed I2C and I3C bus, routing should follow I3C PDG.
Reduced max lengthActual max length for I3C can go up to 1016 mm. Reduced max length is due to legacy I2C Fast Mode Plus (FM+) requirement.
Island terminology'‘Island’ refers to 1 to 3 devices connected and placed near to each other, where the max capacitance per island is 20 pF. For multiple devices within an island, the max stub length to each device is 25.4 mm.
Max frequency2 MHz
Rpu1 kΩ.
R120 Ω. Placed within 25.4 mm distance from CPU.
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Length matching between SDA and SCL signals25.4 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.125 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
CPU buffer driver strength40 Ω.
Max device buffer driver strength90 Ω
Signal name/ listI3C[0:2]_SDA, I3C[0:2]_SCL, I3C1A_SDA, I3C1A_SCL, ISH_I3C[0:1]_SDA, ISH_I3C[0:1]_SCL.

Signal Group: Rx-Tx

Signal MRTS

Segment Lengths For Mixed I3C/I2C Bus, Up To I2C Fast Mode Plus

I3C 1-Island (Device Down) Topology Segment Lengths For Mixed I3C/I2C Bus, Up To I2C Fast Mode Plus Routing Guidelines

I3C 2-Island Daisy Chain (Device Down) Topology

I3C 2-Island Daisy Chain (Device Down) Topology Diagram
I3C 2-Island Daisy Chain (Device Down) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Mixed bus topologyThis topology supports usages with a mix of I2C and I3C devices. For mixed I2C and I3C bus, the routing needs to follow the I3C PDG.
Reduced max lengthActual max length for I3C can go up to 762 mm. Reduced max length is due to legacy I2C Fast Mode Plus (FM+) requirement.
Island terminology'‘Island’ refers to 1 to 3 devices connected and placed near to each other, where the max capacitance per island is 20 pF. For multiple devices within an island, the max stub length to each device is 25.4 mm.
Max frequency2 MHz
Rpu1 kΩ.
R120 Ω. Placed within 25.4 mm distance from CPU.
R220 Ω. Placed within 25.4 mm distance to device.
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Length matching between SDA and SCL signals25.4 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.125 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
Max device buffer driver strength90 Ω
Signal name/ listI3C[0:2]_SDA, I3C[0:2]_SCL, I3C1A_SDA, I3C1A_SCL, ISH_I3C[0:1]_SDA, ISH_I3C[0:1]_SCL.
CPU buffer driver strength40 Ω.

Signal Group: Rx-Tx

Signal MRTS
Segment NameInstanceCategoryStartEnd
CPUDevice01
BOTrace12
R1Resistor23
R1Resistor24
RpuResistor45
1p8VRail5-1
M1Trace36
M1Trace37
R21Resistor68
BI1Trace89
Island1Device9-1
M2Trace710
R22Resistor1011
BI2Trace1112
Island2Device12-1

NoteDetail
R1[1] 33 Ω ± 5% for max total length < 127 mm. [2] 20 Ω ± 5% for max total length ≥ 127mm. Placed within 25.4 mm distance from CPU.

Max frequency10 MHz
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).

FORCEPR#

FORCEPR# Topology

FORCEPR# Topology Diagram
FORCEPR# Topology Notes
NoteDetail
R-1, R-2, R-n75 Ω ≤ R-n + Dev-n drive strength ≤ 200 Ω. [1] Drive strength of each device should be controlled within 75 Ω to 200 Ω, use an additional resistor if the device drive strength is too strong. [2] Optionally, if the device drive strength is ≥ 75 Ω (weak), R-n is not needed. [3] Recommended to be placed < 127 mm from respective device.
Rpu2.2 kΩ ± 20%. Total length can be extended up to 1524 mm. Refer to "FORCEPR# Topology Routing Length vs Rpu Guideline Table" for details.
Signal name/ listFORCEPR#

Segment Lengths

B0 + M1 + M2MS, DSL, SL889Max length for BO < 127 mm and M2 < 127 mm. Total length can be extended up to 1524 mm. Refer to "FORCEPR# Topology Routing Length vs Rpu Guideline Table" for details.

Max Length Total (mm): 889
