GPIO RCOMP

Description: GPIO/ Low Speed I/O RCOMP Guideline

GPIO RCOMP General Guidelines
NoteDetail
SNDW_RCOMP200 Ohm ± 1% to GND Board Rdc: < 0.1 Ohm Board capacitance: < 1.5 pF Trace width 75um with min trace spacing 100um Max total length on board = 9 mm GND shield to any high speed IO with VSS trace/ strip GND reference required

RTC

RTC (Real Time Clock) Topology

32.768 kHz RTC Crystal Topology Diagram
RTC (Real Time Clock) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Length matching between RTC_X1 and RTC_X2Total length mismatch: 1.27 mm
GND shieldingGND shielding to adjacent signals (especially high speed IO) is recommended.
Reference planeContinuous GND only; do not reference to power planes. If routed as stripline or dual stripline, both top and bottom reference/ adjacent planes MUST be solid continuous ground.
External capacitor valuesExternal capacitors C1 and C2 must be matched (C1 = C2). Capacitor values should be tuned accordingly with respect to load capacitance for RTC crystal If the crystal load capacitance reduces (per component datasheet information), then C1/C2 should be reduced accordingly as well. For example, if the Cload is close to 10pF, then a more optimized C1/C2 value would be closer to 8pF (instead of 13pF) Due to vendor variation in crystal characteristic, layout variation and PCB trace, calculation is recommended to determine the C1/C2 value.
Main route (MR)Main route (MR) is recommended to be limited to SL/ DSL to limit coupling and impact from EMI/ RFI sources.
Rs resistorsResistors Rs1 and Rs2 are used as EMI/ RFI CMC placeholder (which can be stuffed as 0 Ohm placeholders). They can be omitted if the platform has no EMI/ RFI issue.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia PlacementNotes
Tx2Total Channelrecommended to minimize number of vias

Segment Lengths

RTC (Real Time Clock) Topology Segment Lengths Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)
BOMS, DSL, SL12.7
MRDSL, SL

Max Length Total (mm): 20.3

Max Length Total Note: Max length of 20.3 mm is based on 0402 resistor and capacitor sizes assumption. Max length can be 25.4 mm if component sizes are reduced from 0402 to 0201.

SMBus 2.0/SMLink

SMBus 2.0/SMLink General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Note 1Multiple options for pull-up/ pull-down and current assist strengths are provided for a particular total bus capacitance. Choose the optimal value for system based on design considerations like power, BOM and cost.
Note 2Trace capacitance per inch is approximately CL = 85√єr / Zo pF, єr - dielectric constant of material, Zo - trace impedance.
Note 3Bus capacitance calculation assumptions: [1] Device capacitance = 5 pF to 10 pF per SMBus 2.0/ SMLink device. [2] Motherboard board trace capacitance = 2 pF to 5 pF per inch of trace length. [3] CPU pin capacitance = 8 pF to 10 pF.

SMBus 2.0/ SMLink Topology

SMBus 2.0/ SMLink Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Stackup layer (microstrip/ stripline/ dual stripline)MS/ SL/ DSL.
Characteristic impedance30 Ω to 70 Ω.
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Trace spacing between CLK and other signals [1] 0.375 mm: Frequency of other signals > 1 GHz. [2] 0.250 mm: Frequency of other signals > 100 MHz. [3] 0.125 mm: Frequency of other signals ≤ 100 MHz.
Trace spacing between DATA and other signals0.125 mm
Trace segment lengthRefer to bus capacitance table.
Total trace length (DATA, CLK)Individual trace lengths should meet total bus capacitance (Cb) requirements for the mode of operation. Refer to the pull-up/ pull-down tables for the supported bus capacitance.
Length matching between DATA and CLK signals25.4 mm
Pull-up resistor placementNo restriction.
Pull-up resistor value tolerance± 5%
Max stub length to pull-up resistor25.4 mm
Board trace characteristic assumptions for default pull-up recommendationBoard trace resistance per length = 20 Ω per meter. Board trace capacitance per length = 208 pF per meter.
Extended length supportFor extended length support, refer to "813278_PTL-UH_I2C_SMBUS_SMLINK_LSIO_Flexi_PDG". Potential enablers: [1] Reduced trace resistance. [2] Reduced trace capacitance. [3] Optimized pull-up resistor placement.
Signal name/ listSMBCLK, SMBDATA, SMBALERT#, SML[0:1]CLK, SML[0:1]DATA, SML[0:1]ALERT#, USB-C_SMLCLK, USB-C_SMLDATA, USB-C_SML0CLK, USB-C_SML0DATA.

SMBus 2.0/ SMLink Standard Mode (100 kHz)

Frequency: 100 kHz

SMBus 2.0/ SMLink Standard Mode (100 kHz) Settings
Total Bus Capacitance (Cb)External Pull-up StrengthIntel Silicon Pull-down Strength
Up to 50 pF5.6 kΩ100 Ω
Up to 100 pF2.7 kΩ100 Ω
Up to 200 pF1.5 kΩ100 Ω
Up to 300 pF1 kΩ100 Ω
Up to 400 pF820 Ω100 Ω

Frequency: 400 kHz

SMBus 2.0/ SMLink Fast Mode (400 kHz) Settings
Total Bus Capacitance (Cb)External Pull-up StrengthIntel Silicon Pull-down Strength
Up to 50 pF1.8 kΩ100 Ω
Up to 100 pF1.5 kΩ100 Ω
75pF to 200 pF560 Ω100 Ω
85 pF to 300 pF430 Ω50 Ω

SMBus 2.0/ SMLink for DDR5 SPD Topology

SMBus 2.0/ SMLink for DDR5 SPD Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Stackup layer (microstrip/ stripline/ dual stripline)MS/ SL/ DSL.
Characteristic impedance30 Ω to 70 Ω.
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Trace spacing between CLK and other signals [1] 0.375 mm: Frequency of other signals > 1 GHz. [2] 0.250 mm: Frequency of other signals > 100 MHz. [3] 0.125 mm: Frequency of other signals ≤ 100 MHz.
Trace spacing between DATA and other signals0.125 mm
Trace segment lengthRefer to bus capacitance table.
Total trace length (DATA, CLK)Individual trace lengths should meet total bus capacitance (Cb) requirements for the mode of operation. Refer to the pull-up/ pull-down tables for the supported bus capacitance.
Length matching between DATA and CLK signals25.4 mm
Pull-up resistor placementNo restriction.
Pull-up resistor value tolerance± 5%
Max stub length to pull-up resistor25.4 mm
Max stub length to device127 mm
Board trace characteristic assumptions for default pull-up recommendationBoard trace resistance per length = 20 Ω per meter. Board trace capacitance per length = 208 pF per meter.
Extended length supportFor extended length support, refer to "813278_PTL-UH_I2C_SMBUS_SMLINK_LSIO_Flexi_PDG". Potential enablers: [1] Reduced trace resistance. [2] Reduced trace capacitance. [3] Optimized pull-up resistor placement.
Max SPD device input capacitance5 pF
General recommendations for DDR5 SPD[1] It is recommended to have a dedicated bus for DDR5 SPD usage. [2] If dedicated bus is not possible, it is recommended to use a voltage translator to shift the signal down to 1V to match the SPD device.
Signal name/ listSMBCLK, SMBDATA, SMBALERT#, SML[0:1]CLK, SML[0:1]DATA, SML[0:1]ALERT#, USB-C_SMLCLK, USB-C_SMLDATA, USB-C_SML0CLK, USB-C_SML0DATA.

SoundWire

SoundWire Large System: 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology

SoundWire Large System: 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology Diagram
SoundWire Large System: 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
M_Cable characteristic impedance target50 Ω ± 10%.
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Max frequency12.288 MHz
SoundWire ports supportedSingle-lane: Port #0, Port #1, Port #2, Port #3. Multi-lane: Port #2 (up to 3 data lane), Port #3 (up to 4 data lane).
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals5.08 mm
CPU TX & RX timing register configurationFor total length < 600 mm: [1] CLDS = 5 Clock Period [2] DODS/DODSE/DODSE2 = 7 Clock Period [3] DOAIS/DOAISE/DOAISE2 = 9 Clock Period For total length ≥ 600 mm: [1] CLDS = 6 Clock Period [2] DODS/DODSE/DODSE2 = 7 Clock Period [3] DOAIS/DOAISE/DOAISE2 = 9 Clock Period Please refer to "Intel Smart Sound Technology ACPI Configuration" for further details on how to configure timing register. (BIOS Specification Doc#:  609917)
CPU buffer driver strength50 Ω, slew 11.
Device buffer driver strength & resistor combination1) Device buffer driver strength of 20 Ω ± 30% 2) Device series resistor of 56 Ω ± 5% Refer to section on "Additional Guidelines - SoundWire* Interface Design Guidelines" for resistor placement to achieve the recommended device drive impedance target.
Signal name/ listSingle-lane: SNDW[0:3]_CLK, SNDW[0:3]_DATA. Multi-lane: SNDW[2:3]_CLK, SNDW2_DATA[0:2], SNDW3_DATA[0:3].
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement

SoundWire Large System: 2-Load Star Topology

SoundWire Large System: 2-Load Star (Add-In Card) Topology Diagram
SoundWire Large System: 2-Load Star (Device Down) Topology Diagram
SoundWire Large System: 2-Load Star Topology Notes
NoteDetail
M_Cable characteristic impedance target50 Ω ± 10%.
R10 Ω placeholder. To be placed 10 mm to 15 mm from the branch.
R20 Ω placeholder. To be placed 5 mm to 10 mm after the branch.
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Length matching between branch for Device 1 & 2 (Option 1: M_cable or Option 2: M4)10 mm
Max frequency9.6 MHz
SoundWire ports supportedPort #0, Port #1, Port #2, Port #3.
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals5.08 mm
CPU TX & RX timing register configurationFor total length < 850. 9 mm: [1] CLDS = 5 Clock Period [2] DODS/DODSE/DODSE2 = 10 Clock Period [3] DOAIS/DOAISE/DOAISE2 = 10 Clock Period For total length ≥ 850.9 mm: [1] CLDS = 9 Clock Period [2] DODS/DODSE/DODSE2 = 10 Clock Period [3] DOAIS/DOAISE/DOAISE2 = 10 Clock Period Please refer to "Intel Smart Sound Technology ACPI Configuration" for further details on how to configure timing register. (BIOS Specification Doc#:  609917)
CPU buffer driver strength50 Ω, slew 11.
Device buffer driver strength & resistor combination1) Device buffer driver strength of 20 Ω ± 30% 2) Device series resistor of 56 Ω ± 5% Refer to section on "Additional Guidelines - SoundWire* Interface Design Guidelines" for resistor placement to achieve the recommended device drive impedance target.

M2MS5
M3MS10

M_CableCable550

SoundWire Large System: 4-Load Star (Device Down) Topology

SoundWire Large System: 4-Load Star (Device Down) Topology Diagram
SoundWire Large System: 4-Load Star (Device Down) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
R10 Ω placeholder. To be placed 10 mm to 15 mm from the first branch from CPU.
R20 Ω placeholder. To be placed 5 mm to 10 mm from the device.
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Length matching between branch (M3_1 & M3_2)10 mm
Max frequency9.6 MHz
SoundWire ports supportedPort #0, Port #1, Port #2, Port #3.
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals5.08 mm
CPU TX & RX timing register configurationFor total length < 571.5 mm: [1] CLDS = 5 Clock Period [2] DODS/DODSE/DODSE2 = 10 Clock Period [3] DOAIS/DOAISE/DOAISE2 = 10 Clock Period For total length ≥ 571.5 mm: [1] CLDS = 9 Clock Period [2] DODS/DODSE/DODSE2 = 10 Clock Period [3] DOAIS/DOAISE/DOAISE2 = 10 Clock Period Please refer to "Intel Smart Sound Technology ACPI Configuration" for further details on how to configure timing register. (BIOS Specification Doc#:  609917)
CPU buffer driver strength50 Ω, slew 11.
Device buffer driver strength & resistor combination1) Device buffer driver strength of 20 Ω ± 30% 2) Device series resistor of 91 Ω ± 5% Refer to section on "Additional Guidelines - SoundWire* Interface Design Guidelines" for resistor placement to achieve the recommended device drive impedance target.
Signal name/ listSNDW[0:3]_CLK, SNDW[0:3]_DATA.

SoundWire Large System: 2-Load Dumbbell Topology

SoundWire Large System: 2-Load Dumbbell (Device Down) Topology
SoundWire Large System: 2-Load Dumbbell (Add-In Card) Topology
SoundWire Large System: 2-Load Dumbbell Topology Notes
NoteDetail
M_Cable1 characteristic impedance target50 Ω ± 10%.
R1Option 1: 10 Ω ± 10%. To be placed on SNDW_CLK only, and 10 mm from the branching. Option 2: 22 Ω ± 10%. To be placed on SNDW_CLK only, and 10 mm from the branching.
R2Option 1: 10 Ω ± 10%. To be placed on SNDW_CLK only, and 10 mm from the branching. Option 2: 22 Ω ± 10%. To be placed on SNDW_CLK only, and 10 mm from the branching.
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Max frequency9.6 MHz
SoundWire ports supportedPort #0, Port #1, Port #2, Port #3.
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals5.08 mm
CPU TX & RX timing register configurationFor total length < 1003.3 mm: [1] CLDS = 5 Clock Period [2] DODS/DODSE/DODSE2 = 10 Clock Period [3] DOAIS/DOAISE/DOAISE2 = 10 Clock Period For total length ≥ 1003.3 mm: [1] CLDS = 9 Clock Period [2] DODS/DODSE/DODSE2 = 10 Clock Period [3] DOAIS/DOAISE/DOAISE2 = 10 Clock Period Please refer to "Intel Smart Sound Technology ACPI Configuration" for further details on how to configure timing register. (BIOS Specification Doc#:  609917)
CPU buffer driver strength50 Ω, slew 11.
Device buffer driver strength & resistor combination1) Device buffer driver strength of 20 Ω ± 30% 2) Device series resistor of 68 Ω ± 5% Refer to section on "Additional Guidelines - SoundWire* Interface Design Guidelines" for resistor placement to achieve the recommended device drive impedance target.

SoundWire Large System: 3 to 4-Load Dumbbell Topology Notes
NoteDetail
M_Cable_[1:2] characteristic impedance target50 Ω ± 10%.
R115 Ω ± 10%. To be placed on SNDW_CLK only, and 10 mm from the branching.
R215 Ω ± 10%. To be placed on SNDW_CLK only, and 10 mm from the branching.
Multiload supportThis topology supports up to 4 devices. For 3-Load topology, only device 2/ 3/ 4 can be removed.
Length ExtensionTotal length for 3-Load topology can be extended up to 520 mm by increase segment length: [1] M4 + M_cable1 = 300 mm [2] M5 = 300 mm
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Max frequency9.6 MHz
SoundWire ports supportedPort #0, Port #1, Port #2, Port #3.
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals5.08 mm
CPU TX & RX timing register configurationFor total length < 508 mm: [1] CLDS = 5 Clock Period [2] DODS/DODSE/DODSE2 = 10 Clock Period [3] DOAIS/DOAISE/DOAISE2 = 10 Clock Period For total length ≥ 508 mm: [1] CLDS = 9 Clock Period [2] DODS/DODSE/DODSE2 = 10 Clock Period [3] DOAIS/DOAISE/DOAISE2 = 10 Clock Period Please refer to "Intel Smart Sound Technology ACPI Configuration" for further details on how to configure timing register. (BIOS Specification Doc#:  609917)

Device buffer driver strength & resistor combination1) Device buffer driver strength of 20 Ω ± 30% 2) Device series resistor of 91 Ω ± 5% Refer to section on "Additional Guidelines - SoundWire* Interface Design Guidelines" for resistor placement to achieve the recommended device drive impedance target.

Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).

NoteDetail
Multiload supportThis topology supports up to 4 devices where device placements are interchangable.
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Max frequency12.288 MHz
SoundWire ports supported1 to 4-Load topology: Single-lane: Port #0, Port #1, Port #2, Port #3. 1-Load topology: Multi-lane: Port #2 (up to 3 data lane), Port #3 (up to 4 data lane).
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals5.08 mm
CPU TX & RX timing register configuration[1] CLDS = 5 Clock Period [2] DODS/DODSE/DODSE2 = 10 Clock Period [3] DOAIS/DOAISE/DOAISE2 = 10 Clock Period Please refer to "Intel Smart Sound Technology ACPI Configuration" for further details on how to configure timing register. Device buffer driver strength & resistor combination1) Device buffer driver strength of 20 Ω ± 30% 2) Device series resistor of 56 Ω ± 5% Refer to section on "Additional Guidelines - SoundWire* Interface Design Guidelines" for resistor placement to achieve the recommended device drive impedance target.

[Internal Validation]SoundWire Large System: 4-Load Star (AIC) Topology

NoteDetail
M_Cable_1/ M_Cable_2 characteristic impedance target50 Ω ± 10%.
R10 Ω placeholder. To be placed 10 mm to 15 mm from the first branch from CPU.
R20 Ω placeholder. To be placed 5 mm to 10 mm from the device.
Number of vias allowed4
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Max length, totalThis refers to the length from CPU to the end device of each branch. [1] B0 + M1 + M2 + M3_1 + M_Cable_1 + M4_1_1 + M5_1_1; or [2] B0 + M1 + M2 + M3_1 + M_Cable_1 + M4_1_2 + M5_1_2; or [3] B0 + M1 + M2 + M3_2 + M_Cable_2 + M4_2_1 + M5_2_1; or [4] B0 + M1 + M2 + M3_2 + M_Cable_2 + M4_2_2 + M5_2_2.

[For Internal Validation] Additional Guidelines - SoundWire* Interface Design Guidelines

Description: In the topology section the device buffer strength target recommendations are different depending on the Topology and its configuration. If devices used do not have buffer strengths that match the target recommendations and do not have the ability to adjust the buffer strengths through software you can adjust the impedance via an external resistor (R1) in series near the device, between the device and processor. To determine R1 the formula is: R1=Device Buffer Impedance Target - Actual Device Buffer Impedance.

[For Internal Validation] SoundWire* Device Drive Impedance Adjustment Diagram
[For Internal Validation] Additional Guidelines - SoundWire* Interface Design Guidelines Notes
NoteDetail
M110 mm
R1R1 = Device Drive Impedance Target - Device Buffer Strength. For example: Device Drive Impedance Target = 80 Ω. Device Buffer Strength = 45 Ω. Then R1 = 80 Ω - 45 Ω = 35 Ω.

SPI0 Flash

SPI0 1-Load MAF (Device Down) Topology

SPI0 1-Load MAF (Device Down) Topology Diagram
SPI0 1-Load MAF (Device Down) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Reference planeContinuous ground only.
Max frequency76.8MHz
Flash programmerFor connection to Flash programmer, requires additional isolation circuitry to protect CPU from back-feed voltage.
R1 (50 MHz)18 Ω ± 5%. To be placed within 30.48 mm from the device on SPI0_CLK, SPI0_MISO, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_IO2 and SPI0_IO3.
R1 (76.8 MHz)18 Ω ± 10%. To be placed within 12.7 mm from the device on SPI0_CLK, SPI0_MISO, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_IO2 and SPI0_IO3.
Flash device electrical characteristics recommendation for 50MHz support: Option 1[1] Driver strength spec: 40 Ω or stronger across worse case corners. [2] 0.4 ns ≤ rise/ fall time measured at 30% to 70% ≤ 1.25 ns based on 30 pF test load. [3] Output capacitance, Cout ≤ 14 pF (including RPMC die). [4] Input capacitance, Cin ≤ 12 pF (including RPMC die). [5] Data input setup time ≤ 3 ns. [6] Data input hold time ≤ 3 ns. [7] CLK to DATA output valid time, min: 1 ns, based on 30 pF test load. [8] CLK to DATA output valid time, max: 9 ns (50% to 50%), based on 30 pF test load.
Flash device electrical characteristics recommendation for 50MHz support: Option 2[1] Driver strength spec: 50 Ω or stronger across worse case corners. [2] 0.4 ns ≤ rise/ fall time measured at 30% to 70% ≤ 1.45 ns based on 30 pF test load. [3] Output capacitance, Cout ≤ 16 pF (including RPMC die). [4] Input capacitance, Cin ≤ 12 pF (including RPMC die). [5] Data input setup time ≤ 3 ns. [6] Data input hold time ≤ 3 ns. [7] CLK to DATA output valid time, min: 1 ns, based on 30 pF test load. [8] CLK to DATA output valid time, max: 6.5 ns (50% to 50%), based on 30 pF test load.
Flash device electrical characteristics recommendation for 76.8MHz support:[1] Driver strength spec: 50 Ω or stronger across worse case corners. [2] 0.4 ns ≤ rise/ fall time measured at 30% to 70% ≤ 2 ns based on 30 pF test load. [3] Output capacitance, Cout ≤ 16 pF (including RPMC die). [4] Input capacitance, Cin ≤ 12 pF (including RPMC die). [5] Data input setup time ≤ 1.75 ns. [6] Data input hold time ≤ 2 ns. [7] CLK to DATA output valid time, min: 1 ns, based on 30pF test load. [8] CLK to DATA output valid time, max: 6 ns (50% to 50%), based on 30 pF test load.
Length matching between CLK and DATA/ CS# signals12.7 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.250 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
Signal name/ listSPI0_CLK, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_MISO, SPI0_IO2, SPI0_IO3, SPI0_CS0# (for flash).

SPI0 2-Load Branch MAF (Device Down) with Flash Only Topology

SPI0 2-Load Branch MAF (Device Down) with Flash Only Topology Diagram
SPI0 2-Load Branch MAF (Device Down) with Flash Only Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Reference planeContinuous ground only.
Max frequency50 MHz
Flash programmerFor connection to Flash programmer, requires additional isolation circuitry to protect CPU from back-feed voltage.
R1[1] DATA: 30 Ω ± 5%. To be placed within 7.62 mm from the branch on SPI0_MISO, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_IO2 and SPI0_IO3. [2] CLK: 22 Ω ± 5%. To be placed within 7.62 mm from the branch on SPI0_CLK.
R25 Ω. To be placed on SPI0_CLK, SPI0_MISO, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_IO2 and SPI0_IO3. It is optional to have R2 on the channel. It can be removed to reduce BOM cost.
Flash device electrical characteristics recommendation for 50MHz support: Option 1[1] Driver strength spec: 40 Ω or stronger across worse case corners. [2] 0.4 ns ≤ rise/ fall time measured at 30% to 70% ≤ 1.25 ns based on 30 pF test load. [3] Output capacitance, Cout ≤ 14 pF (including RPMC die). [4] Input capacitance, Cin ≤ 12 pF (including RPMC die). [5] Data input setup time ≤ 3 ns. [6] Data input hold time ≤ 3 ns. [7] CLK to DATA output valid time, min: 1 ns, based on 30 pF test load. [8] CLK to DATA output valid time, max: 9 ns (50% to 50%), based on 30 pF test load.
Flash device electrical characteristics recommendation for 50MHz support: Option 2[1] Driver strength spec: 50 Ω or stronger across worse case corners. [2] 0.4 ns ≤ rise/ fall time measured at 30% to 70% ≤ 1.45 ns based on 30 pF test load. [3] Output capacitance, Cout ≤ 16 pF (including RPMC die). [4] Input capacitance, Cin ≤ 12 pF (including RPMC die). [5] Data input setup time ≤ 3 ns. [6] Data input hold time ≤ 3 ns. [7] CLK to DATA output valid time, min: 1 ns, based on 30 pF test load. [8] CLK to DATA output valid time, max: 6.5 ns (50% to 50%), based on 30 pF test load.
Stuffing resistorIf one of the devices is unstuffed (rework), treat it as point-to-point topology thus place stuffing resistor as close as possible to the branch to avoid long stub length.
Length matching between CLK and DATA/ CS# signals12.7 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.250 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
Signal name/ listSPI0_CLK, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_MISO, SPI0_IO2, SPI0_IO3, SPI0_CS[0:1]# (for flash).

SPI0 2-Load Branch MAF (Device Down) with Flash and TPM Topology

SPI0 2-Load Branch MAF (Device Down) with Flash and TPM Topology Diagram
SPI0 2-Load Branch MAF (Device Down) with Flash and TPM Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Reference planeContinuous ground only.
Max frequencyOption 1: Segment Lengths for Maximum 80 MHz Flash: 76.8 MHz; TPM: 17 MHz; Debug Tool: 17MHz Option 2: Segment Lengths for Maximum 50 MHz Flash 50 MHz; TPM: 33 MHz; Debug Tool: 33MHz
Flash programmerFor connection to Flash programmer, requires additional isolation circuitry to protect CPU from back-feed voltage.
R1 (50 MHz)30 Ω ± 5%. To be placed within 7.62 mm from the branch on SPI0_CLK, SPI0_MISO, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_IO2 and SPI0_IO3.
R2 (50 MHz)51 Ω ± 5%. To be placed within 7.62 mm from the branch on SPI0_CLK, SPI0_MISO, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_IO2 and SPI0_IO3.
R3 (50 MHz)5 Ω. To be placed within 7.62 mm from the branch on SPI0_CLK, SPI0_MISO, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_IO2 and SPI0_IO3. It is optional to have R3 on the channel. It can be removed to reduce BOM cost.
R1 (76.8Hz)10 Ω ± 10%. To be placed within 12.7 mm from the device on SPI0_CLK, SPI0_MISO, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_IO2 and SPI0_IO3.
R2 (76.8 MHz)330 Ω ± 10%. To be placed within 2.54 mm from the branch on SPI0_CLK, SPI0_MISO, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_IO2 and SPI0_IO3.
R3 (76.8 MHz)No R3 required (0 Ω/short pad).
Flash device electrical characteristics recommendation for 50MHz support: Option 1[1] Driver strength spec: 40 Ω or stronger across worse case corners. [2] 0.4 ns ≤ rise/ fall time measured at 30% to 70% ≤ 1.25 ns based on 30 pF test load. [3] Output capacitance, Cout ≤ 14 pF (including RPMC die). [4] Input capacitance, Cin ≤ 12 pF (including RPMC die). [5] Data input setup time ≤ 3 ns. [6] Data input hold time ≤ 3 ns. [7] CLK to DATA output valid time, min: 1 ns, based on 30 pF test load. [8] CLK to DATA output valid time, max: 9 ns (50% to 50%), based on 30 pF test load.
Flash device electrical characteristics recommendation for 50MHz support: Option 2[1] Driver strength spec: 50 Ω or stronger across worse case corners. [2] 0.4 ns ≤ rise/ fall time measured at 30% to 70% ≤ 1.45 ns based on 30 pF test load. [3] Output capacitance, Cout ≤ 16 pF (including RPMC die). [4] Input capacitance, Cin ≤ 12 pF (including RPMC die). [5] Data input setup time ≤ 3 ns. [6] Data input hold time ≤ 3 ns. [7] CLK to DATA output valid time, min: 1 ns, based on 30 pF test load. [8] CLK to DATA output valid time, max: 6.5 ns (50% to 50%), based on 30 pF test load.
Flash device electrical characteristics recommendation for 76.8MHz support:[1] Driver strength spec: 50 Ω or stronger across worse case corners. [2] 0.4 ns ≤ rise/ fall time measured at 30% to 70% ≤ 2 ns based on 30 pF test load. [3] Output capacitance, Cout ≤ 16 pF (including RPMC die). [4] Input capacitance, Cin ≤ 12 pF (including RPMC die). [5] Data input setup time ≤ 1.75 ns. [6] Data input hold time ≤ 2 ns. [7] CLK to DATA output valid time, min: 1 ns, based on 30pF test load. [8] CLK to DATA output valid time, max: 6 ns (50% to 50%), based on 30 pF test load.
Stuffing resistorIf one of the devices is unstuffed (rework), treat it as point-to-point topology thus place stuffing resistor as close as possible to the branch to avoid long stub length.
Length matching between CLK and DATA/ CS# signals12.7 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.250 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
Signal name/ listSPI0_CLK, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_MISO, SPI0_IO2, SPI0_IO3, SPI0_CS0# (for flash), SPI0_CS2# (for TPM).

SPI0 3-Load Branch MAF (Device Down) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Reference planeContinuous ground only.
Max frequencyFlash 1 & Flash 2: 50 MHz. TPM: 33 MHz.
Flash programmerFor connection to Flash programmer, requires additional isolation circuitry to protect CPU from back-feed voltage.
R130 Ω ± 5%. To be placed within 10.16 mm from the branch on SPI0_CLK, SPI0_MISO, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_IO2 and SPI0_IO3.
R251 Ω ± 5%. To be placed on within 10.16 mm from the branch SPI0_CLK, SPI0_MISO, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_IO2 and SPI0_IO3.
R34 Ω. To be placed within 10.16 mm from the branch on SPI0_CLK, SPI0_MISO, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_IO2 and SPI0_IO3. It is optional to have R3 on the channel. It can be removed to reduce BOM cost.
Length from CPU to flash 1 or flash 2Length from CPU to flash 1 or flash 2: = BO + M1 + M2 + M3 + M4 or BO + M1 + M2 + M3 + M5
Flash device electrical characteristics recommendation for 50MHz support: Option 1[1] Driver strength spec: 40 Ω or stronger across worse case corners. [2] 0.4 ns ≤ rise/ fall time measured at 30% to 70% ≤ 1.25 ns based on 30 pF test load. [3] Output capacitance, Cout ≤ 14 pF (including RPMC die). [4] Input capacitance, Cin ≤ 12 pF (including RPMC die). [5] Data input setup time ≤ 3 ns. [6] Data input hold time ≤ 3 ns. [7] CLK to DATA output valid time, min: 1 ns, based on 30 pF test load. [8] CLK to DATA output valid time, max: 9 ns (50% to 50%), based on 30 pF test load.
Flash device electrical characteristics recommendation for 50MHz support: Option 2[1] Driver strength spec: 50 Ω or stronger across worse case corners. [2] 0.4 ns ≤ rise/ fall time measured at 30% to 70% ≤ 1.45 ns based on 30 pF test load. [3] Output capacitance, Cout ≤ 16 pF (including RPMC die). [4] Input capacitance, Cin ≤ 12 pF (including RPMC die). [5] Data input setup time ≤ 3 ns. [6] Data input hold time ≤ 3 ns. [7] CLK to DATA output valid time, min: 1 ns, based on 30 pF test load. [8] CLK to DATA output valid time, max: 6.5 ns (50% to 50%), based on 30 pF test load.
Stuffing resistorIf one of the devices is unstuffed (rework), treat it as 2-Load topology thus place stuffing resistor as close as possible to the branch to avoid long stub length.

NoteDetail

R1 (76.8 MHz)[1] DATA: 18 Ω ± 10%. To be placed within 7.62 mm from the branch on SPI0_MISO, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_IO2 and SPI0_IO3. [2] CLK: 10 Ω ± 10%. To be placed within 7.62 mm from the branch on SPI0_CLK.

Flash device electrical characteristics recommendation for 50MHz support: Option 1[1] Driver strength spec: 40 Ω or stronger across worse case corners. [2] 0.4 ns ≤ rise/ fall time measured at 30% to 70% ≤ 1.25 ns based on 30 pF test load. [3] Output capacitance, Cout ≤ 14 pF (including RPMC die). [4] Input capacitance, Cin ≤ 12 pF (including RPMC die). [5] Data input setup time ≤ 3 ns. [6] Data input hold time ≤ 3 ns. [7] CLK to DATA output valid time, min: 1 ns, based on 30 pF test load. [8] CLK to DATA output valid time, max: 9 ns (50% to 50%), based on 30 pF test load.

[4] Input capacitance, Cin ≤ 12 pF (including RPMC die). [5] Data input setup time ≤ 3 ns. [6] Data input hold time ≤ 3 ns. [7] CLK to DATA output valid time, min: 1 ns, based on 30 pF test load. [8] CLK to DATA output valid time, max: 6.5 ns (50% to 50%), based on 30 pF test load.

M5MS, DSL, SL81.28

Max Length Total (mm): 111.76

Max Length Total Note: 1) Max length between CPU to the furthest end device = 111.76 mm;​ 2) Total topology length = 195.58 mm.

SPI0 3-Load Branch (Device Down) with G3 EC Isolation FET of Flash Topology

SPI0 3-Load Branch (Device Down) with G3 EC Isolation FET Topology Diagram
SPI0 3-Load Branch (Device Down) with G3 EC Isolation FET of Flash Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Reference planeContinuous ground only.
Max frequency50 MHz
R1[1] DATA: 30 Ω ± 5%. To be placed within 7.62 mm from the branch on SPI0_MISO, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_IO2 and SPI0_IO3. [2] CLK: 22 Ω ± 5%. To be placed within 7.62 mm from the branch on SPI0_CLK.
Flash device electrical characteristics recommendation for 50MHz support: Option 1[1] Driver strength spec: 40 Ω or stronger across worse case corners. [2] 0.4 ns ≤ rise/ fall time measured at 30% to 70% ≤ 1.25 ns based on 30 pF test load. [3] Output capacitance, Cout ≤ 14 pF (including RPMC die). [4] Input capacitance, Cin ≤ 12 pF (including RPMC die). [5] Data input setup time ≤ 3 ns. [6] Data input hold time ≤ 3 ns. [7] CLK to DATA output valid time, min: 1 ns, based on 30 pF test load. [8] CLK to DATA output valid time, max: 9 ns (50% to 50%), based on 30 pF test load.
Flash device electrical characteristics recommendation for 50MHz support: Option 2[1] Driver strength spec: 50 Ω or stronger across worse case corners. [2] 0.4 ns ≤ rise/ fall time measured at 30% to 70% ≤ 1.45 ns based on 30 pF test load. [3] Output capacitance, Cout ≤ 16 pF (including RPMC die). [4] Input capacitance, Cin ≤ 12 pF (including RPMC die). [5] Data input setup time ≤ 3 ns. [6] Data input hold time ≤ 3 ns. [7] CLK to DATA output valid time, min: 1 ns, based on 30 pF test load. [8] CLK to DATA output valid time, max: 6.5 ns (50% to 50%), based on 30 pF test load.
Length from CPU to flash 1 or flash 2Length from CPU to flash 1 or flash 2: = BO + M1 + M2 + M3 + M4 or BO + M1 + M2 + M3 + M5
Stuffing resistorIf one of the devices is unstuffed (rework), treat it as 2-Load topology thus place stuffing resistor as close as possible to the branch to avoid long stub length.
Length matching between CLK and DATA/ CS# signals12.7 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.250 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
FET component criteriaRon < 4.5 Ω. Cin < 6 pF.
Signal name/ listSPI0_CLK, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_MISO, SPI0_IO2, SPI0_IO3, SPI0_CS[0:1]# (for flash).

SPI0 3-Load Branch (Device Down) with G3 Isolation FET of Flash and TPM Topology

SPI0 3-Load Branch (Device Down) with G3 Isolation FET of Flash Sharing and TPM Topology Diagram
SPI0 3-Load Branch (Device Down) with G3 Isolation FET of Flash and TPM Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Reference planeContinuous ground only.
Max frequencyOption 1: Segment Lengths for Maximum 80 MHz Flash: 76.8 MHz; TPM: 14.3 MHz; Debug Tool: 12 MHz; EC: 50 MHz Option 2: Segment Lengths for Maximum 50 MHz Flash 50 MHz; TPM: 33 MHz; EC: 50 MHz
R1 (50 MHz)30 Ω ± 5%. To be placed within 10.16mm from the branch on SPI0_CLK, SPI0_MISO, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_IO2 and SPI0_IO3.
R2 (50 MHz)51 Ω ± 5%. To be placed within 10.16 mm from the branch on SPI0_CLK, SPI0_MISO, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_IO2 and SPI0_IO3.
R1 (76.8 MHz)10 Ω ± 10%. To be placed within 10.16 mm from the branch on SPI0_CLK, SPI0_MISO, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_IO2 and SPI0_IO3.
R2 (76.8 MHz)430 Ω ± 10%. To be placed within 10.16 mm from the branch on SPI0_CLK, SPI0_MISO, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_IO2 and SPI0_IO3.
Length from CPU to flash 1Length from CPU to flash 1: = BO + M1 + M2 + M3 + M4
Flash device electrical characteristics recommendation for 50MHz support: Option 1[1] Driver strength spec: 40 Ω or stronger across worse case corners. [2] 0.4 ns ≤ rise/ fall time measured at 30% to 70% ≤ 1.25 ns based on 30 pF test load. [3] Output capacitance, Cout ≤ 14 pF (including RPMC die). [4] Input capacitance, Cin ≤ 12 pF (including RPMC die). [5] Data input setup time ≤ 3 ns. [6] Data input hold time ≤ 3 ns. [7] CLK to DATA output valid time, min: 1 ns, based on 30 pF test load. [8] CLK to DATA output valid time, max: 9 ns (50% to 50%), based on 30 pF test load.
Flash device electrical characteristics recommendation for 50MHz support: Option 2[1] Driver strength spec: 50 Ω or stronger across worse case corners. [2] 0.4 ns ≤ rise/ fall time measured at 30% to 70% ≤ 1.45 ns based on 30 pF test load. [3] Output capacitance, Cout ≤ 16 pF (including RPMC die). [4] Input capacitance, Cin ≤ 12 pF (including RPMC die). [5] Data input setup time ≤ 3 ns. [6] Data input hold time ≤ 3 ns. [7] CLK to DATA output valid time, min: 1 ns, based on 30 pF test load. [8] CLK to DATA output valid time, max: 6.5 ns (50% to 50%), based on 30 pF test load.
Flash device electrical characteristics recommendation for 76.8MHz support:[1] Driver strength spec: 50 Ω or stronger across worse case corners. [2] 0.4 ns ≤ rise/ fall time measured at 30% to 70% ≤ 2 ns based on 30 pF test load. [3] Output capacitance, Cout ≤ 16 pF (including RPMC die). [4] Input capacitance, Cin ≤ 12 pF (including RPMC die). [5] Data input setup time ≤ 1.75 ns. [6] Data input hold time ≤ 2 ns. [7] CLK to DATA output valid time, min: 1 ns, based on 30pF test load. [8] CLK to DATA output valid time, max: 6 ns (50% to 50%), based on 30 pF test load.
Stuffing resistorIf one of the devices is unstuffed (rework), treat it as 2-Load topology thus place stuffing resistor as close as possible to the branch to avoid long stub length.
Length matching between CLK and DATA/ CS# signals12.7 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.250 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
FET component criteriaRon < 4.5 Ω. Cin < 6 pF.
Signal name/ listSPI0_CLK, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_MISO, SPI0_IO2, SPI0_IO3, SPI0_CS0# (for flash), SPI0_CS2# (for TPM).

SPI0 3-Load Branch (Device Down) with G3 Wired-OR of Flash Topology

SPI0 3-Load Branch (Device Down) with G3 Wired-OR of Flash Topology Diagram
SPI0 3-Load Branch (Device Down) with G3 Wired-OR of Flash Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Reference planeContinuous ground only.
Max frequencyFlash & EC: 50 MHz
EC and CPU branch requirementDelta between BO + M1 + M2 and M6 + M7 shall not exceed 25.4 mm.
Flash programmerFor connection to Flash programmer, requires additional isolation circuitry to protect CPU from back-feed voltage.
R1[1] DATA: 22 Ω ± 5%. To be placed within 12.7 mm from the branch on SPI0_MISO, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_IO2 and SPI0_IO3. [2] CLK: 10 Ω ± 5%. To be placed within 12.7 mm from the branch on SPI0_CLK.
R2[1] DATA: 22 Ω ± 5%. To be placed within 12.7 mm from the branch on SPI0_MISO, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_IO2 and SPI0_IO3. [2] CLK: 10 Ω ± 5%. To be placed within 12.7 mm from the branch on SPI0_CLK.
R3[1] DATA: 22 Ω ± 5%. To be placed within 12.7 mm from the branch on SPI0_MISO, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_IO2 and SPI0_IO3. [2] CLK: 10 Ω ± 5%. To be placed within 12.7 mm from the branch on SPI0_CLK.
R4[1] DATA: 22 Ω ± 5%. To be placed within 12.7 mm from the branch on SPI0_MISO, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_IO2 and SPI0_IO3. [2] CLK: 10 Ω ± 5%. To be placed within 12.7 mm from the branch on SPI0_CLK.
Flash device electrical characteristics recommendation for 50MHz support: Option 1[1] Driver strength spec: 40 Ω or stronger across worse case corners. [2] 0.4 ns ≤ rise/ fall time measured at 30% to 70% ≤ 1.25 ns based on 30 pF test load. [3] Output capacitance, Cout ≤ 14 pF (including RPMC die). [4] Input capacitance, Cin ≤ 12 pF (including RPMC die). [5] Data input setup time ≤ 3 ns. [6] Data input hold time ≤ 3 ns. [7] CLK to DATA output valid time, min: 1 ns, based on 30 pF test load. [8] CLK to DATA output valid time, max: 9 ns (50% to 50%), based on 30 pF test load.
Flash device electrical characteristics recommendation for 50MHz support: Option 2[1] Driver strength spec: 50 Ω or stronger across worse case corners. [2] 0.4 ns ≤ rise/ fall time measured at 30% to 70% ≤ 1.45 ns based on 30 pF test load. [3] Output capacitance, Cout ≤ 16 pF (including RPMC die). [4] Input capacitance, Cin ≤ 12 pF (including RPMC die). [5] Data input setup time ≤ 3 ns. [6] Data input hold time ≤ 3 ns. [7] CLK to DATA output valid time, min: 1 ns, based on 30 pF test load. [8] CLK to DATA output valid time, max: 6.5 ns (50% to 50%), based on 30 pF test load.
Length matching between CLK and DATA/ CS# signals12.7 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.250 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
Signal name/ listSPI0_CLK, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_MISO, SPI0_IO2, SPI0_IO3, SPI0_CS[0:1]# (for flash).

SPI0 3-Load Branch (Device Down) with G3 Wired-OR of Flash and TPM Topology

SPI0 3-Load Branch (Device Down) with G3 Wired-OR of Flash and TPM Topology Diagram
SPI0 3-Load Branch (Device Down) with G3 Wired-OR of Flash and TPM Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Reference planeContinuous ground only.
Max frequencyFlash & EC: 50 MHz. TPM: 33 MHz.
EC and CPU branch requirementDelta between BO + M1 + M2 and M6 + M7 shall not exceed 25.4 mm.
Flash programmerFor connection to Flash programmer, requires additional isolation circuitry to protect CPU from back-feed voltage.
R1[1] DATA: 10 Ω ± 5%. To be placed within 12.7 mm from the branch on SPI0_MISO, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_IO2 and SPI0_IO3. [2] CLK: 22 Ω ± 5%. To be placed within 12.7 mm from the branch on SPI0_CLK.
R2[1] DATA: 10 Ω ± 5%. To be placed within 12.7 mm from the branch on SPI0_MISO, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_IO2 and SPI0_IO3. [2] CLK: 22 Ω ± 5%. To be placed within 12.7 mm from the branch on SPI0_CLK.
R3[1] DATA: 10 Ω ± 5%. To be placed within 12.7 mm from the branch on SPI0_MISO, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_IO2 and SPI0_IO3. [2] CLK: 22 Ω ± 5%. To be placed within 12.7 mm from the branch on SPI0_CLK.
R451 Ω ± 5%. To be placed within 12.7 mm from the branch on SPI0_CLK, SPI0_MISO, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_IO2 and SPI0_IO3.
Flash device electrical characteristics recommendation for 50MHz support: Option 1[1] Driver strength spec: 40 Ω or stronger across worse case corners. [2] 0.4 ns ≤ rise/ fall time measured at 30% to 70% ≤ 1.25 ns based on 30 pF test load. [3] Output capacitance, Cout ≤ 14 pF (including RPMC die). [4] Input capacitance, Cin ≤ 12 pF (including RPMC die). [5] Data input setup time ≤ 3 ns. [6] Data input hold time ≤ 3 ns. [7] CLK to DATA output valid time, min: 1 ns, based on 30 pF test load. [8] CLK to DATA output valid time, max: 9 ns (50% to 50%), based on 30 pF test load.
Flash device electrical characteristics recommendation for 50MHz support: Option 2[1] Driver strength spec: 50 Ω or stronger across worse case corners. [2] 0.4 ns ≤ rise/ fall time measured at 30% to 70% ≤ 1.45 ns based on 30 pF test load. [3] Output capacitance, Cout ≤ 16 pF (including RPMC die). [4] Input capacitance, Cin ≤ 12 pF (including RPMC die). [5] Data input setup time ≤ 3 ns. [6] Data input hold time ≤ 3 ns. [7] CLK to DATA output valid time, min: 1 ns, based on 30 pF test load. [8] CLK to DATA output valid time, max: 6.5 ns (50% to 50%), based on 30 pF test load.

R11] DATA: 0 Ω placeholder. To be placed within 12.7 mm from the branch on SPI0_MISO, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_IO2 and SPI0_IO3. [2] CLK: 15 Ω ± 5%. To be placed within 12.7 mm from the branch on SPI0_CLK.

NoteDetail

Minimum length, total BO + M1 + M2 + M3 + M4 + M5: 58.42 mm
Device recommendationStandard-Flash: Micron MT25QU.
Device AC timing characteristics Data input setup time < 1.75 ns. Data input hold time < 2 ns. 1 ns < CLK to DATA output valid time < 6 ns based on 30 pF test load.
Device driver strength characteristics Impedance: 30 Ω to 50 Ω. 0.6 ns < rise/ fall time measured at 20% - 80% < 1.2 ns based on 10 pF test load. 5.6 pF ≤ output capacitance, Cout ≤ 5.75 pF. 2 pF ≤ input capacitance, Cin ≤ 10 pF.

SVID

SVID 1-Load (Device Down) Topology

SVID 1-Load (Device Down) Topology Diagram
SVID 1-Load (Device Down) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
VIDSOUT platform resistorsRpu1 = 160 Ω, Rpu2 = 160 Ω, R1 = 10 Ω, R2 = 15 Ω.
VIDSCK platform resistorsRpu1 = Empty, Rpu2 = 82 Ω, R1 = 0 Ω / Short pad, R2 = 15 Ω.
VIDSALERT# platform resistorsRpu1 = 100 Ω, Rpu2 = Empty, R1 = 0 Ω / Short pad, R2 = 0 Ω / Short pad.
Platform resistor tolerance± 5%
Resistor Placement Recommendation (Rpu1, R1, Rpu2, R2)The Rpu1 & R1 resistor should be place close to CPU and Rpu2 & R2 resistor should be place close to IMVP.
Clarification about Rpu1/ Rpu2/ R1/ R2 = Empty/ 0 Ω/ Short Pad[1] Rpu1 or Rpu2 = Empty; The specific side of the trace related to Rpu1 = Empty or Rpu2 = Empty does not need a pull-up resistor to the 1.05V power rail (VDD2H). [2] R1 or R2 = 0 Ω/ Short Pad; The signal does not need a series resistor for the specific part on the trace which is being represented by R1 or R2. Be aware, the trace still needs to remain connected end to end. * It is strongly recommended to refer for the implementation on RVP.
Gen5 VRTT tool validation Stuff VIDSOUT R1 with 0 Ω if VIDSOUT signal swing fails VIL with Gen5 VRTT tool.
Maximum trace DC resistance 7 Ω
Signal PTH/ via transitionSuggest having a GND stitching vias for each signal transition. The GND stitching vias to the signal vias need to be within 5.08 mm from one another.
Reference planeContinuous ground only.
Essential guidelines for routing near switching voltage regulator circuitIt is strongly recommended to meet routing near switching voltage regulator guidelines for SVID signals. Refer to "Switching VR Circuit Guideline" chapter in PDG for the details. (Technical White Paper Doc#:  726825)
Route orderingWhen routing at minimum spacing route ALERT between DATA and CLK.
Length matching between VIDSOUT and VIDSCK± 2.54 mm
Signal name/ listVIDSOUT, VIDSCK, VIDALERT#.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement
Tx6Total Channel
Rx6Total Channel

THC-SPI

THC-SPI 1-Load (for Touch Panel) Topology

THC-SPI 1-Load (for Touch Panel) Topology Diagram
THC-SPI 1-Load (for Touch Panel) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Max frequency42.67MHz (Please contact Intel for higher frequency enabling)
R110 Ω ± 5% To be placed 12.7 mm from the connector on THC0_SPI1_CLK, THC0_SPI1_IO[0:3], THC1_SPI2_CLK, THC1_SPI2_IO[0:3].
M_cableRecommended to use shielded cable.
M_cable electrical characteristics-0.075 dB/inch < Insertion loss < -0.052 dB/inch -32.8 dB < Return loss < -46.2 dB -45.4 dB < Crosstalk < -47.2 dB 42 Ω < Impedance < 62 Ω
Minimum length, total 139.7 mm
Length restriction for full microstrip routingM1 + M2 = 139.7 mm (max).
Length matching between CLK and DATA/ CS# signals12.7 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.125 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
Devices Electrical AssumptionsPlease refer to "SPI Interface and Electrical Assumptions for the Touch Device" chapter in Intel Touch Host Controller Integration Guide for further detials. (Touch Integration Guide Doc#: 778513)
CPU buffer driver strength40 Ω.
Signal name/ listTHC0_SPI1_CLK, THC0_SPI1_IO[0:3], THC0_SPI1_CS#, THC0_SPI1_RST#, THC0_SPI1_INT#, THC1_SPI2_CLK, THC1_SPI2_IO[0:3], THC1_SPI2_CS#, THC1_SPI2_RST#, THC1_SPI2_INT#.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement
Rx, Tx4Total Channel
Tx4Total Channel
Rx4Total Channel

CPUDevice01

M2Trace45

UART

UART0/ UART1 1-Load (Device Down) Topology

UART0/ UART1 1-Load (Device Down) Topology Diagram
UART0/ UART1 1-Load (Device Down) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA/ others signals0.125 mm
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Signal name/ listUART[0:1]_RXD, UART[0:1]_TXD, UART0_RTS#, UART0_CTS#, A_UART1_RXD, A_UART1_TXD, ISH_UART[0:1]_RXD, ISH_UART[0:1]_TXD, ISH_UART0_RTS#, ISH_UART0_CTS#, A_ISH_UART1_RXD, A_ISH_UART1_TXD, CNV_MFUART2_RXD, CNV_MFUART2_TXD.
CPU buffer driver strength50 Ω.

Signal Group: Rx-Tx

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartEnd
CPUDevice01
BOTrace12
M1Trace23
DEVICEDevice3-1

Segment Lengths

UART0/ UART1 1-Load (Device Down) Topology Segment Lengths Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)
BODSL, MS, SL12.7
M1DSL, MS, SL622.3

Max Length Total (mm): 635

UART2 1-Load (Device Down) Topology

UART2 1-Load (Device Down) Topology Diagram
UART2 1-Load (Device Down) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
R113 Ω. Recommended to be placed 12.7 mm from CPU, but can be extended to 50.8 mm maximum if required.
R20 Ω placeholder. If failing device overshoot/ undershoot, a 13 Ω resistor can be stuffed. If possible work with device vendor to determine necessity of R2.
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA/ others signals0.125 mm
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Signal name/ listUART2_RXD, UART2_TXD, UART2_RTS#, UART2_CTS#.
CPU buffer driver strength33 Ω.

Signal Group: Tx

Signal MRTS

CPUDevice01
BOTrace12
R1Resistor23
M1Trace34

M2Trace23

M3Trace45

UFS Reference Clock

Description: (Internal Validation)

(Internal Validation) UFS Reference Clock Topology

UFS Reference Clock Topology Diagram
(Internal Validation) UFS Reference Clock Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Resistor values (for step down from 1.8 V to 1.2 V) R1 = 22 Ohm R2 = 150 Ohm
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Minimum length38.1 mm

M2Cable25.4

XTAL

Crystal Oscillator Topology

Crystal Oscillator (38.4 MHz) Topology Diagram
Crystal Oscillator Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Length matching between XTAL_IN and XTAL_OUTTotal length mismatch: 1.27 mm.
GND shieldingGND shielding to adjacent signals (especially high speed IO) is recommended.
Main route (MR)Main route (MR) is recommended to be limited to SL/ DSL to limit coupling and impact from EMI/ RFI sources.
Reference planeContinuous GND only; do not reference to power planes. If routed as stripline or dual stripline, both top and bottom reference/ adjacent planes MUST be solid continuous ground. Avoid routing directly parallel (under/ over/shadow) to high current power planes. If unavoidable route signal orthogonal to power plane.
External capacitor valueExternal capacitors C1 and C2 must be matched (C1 = C2).Capacitor values should be tuned accordingly with respect to load capacitance for crystal. If the crystal load capacitance reduces (per component datasheet information), then C1/C2 should be reduced accordingly as well. Due to vendor variation in crystal characteristic, layout variation and PCB trace, calculation is recommended to determine the C1/C2 value.
Rs resistorsResistors Rs1 and Rs2 are required for potential stuffing options for RFI/ EMI purposes.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia PlacementNotes
Tx2Total Channelrecommended to minimize number of vias

Segment Lengths

Crystal Oscillator Topology Segment Lengths Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)
BOMS, DSL, SL12.7
MRDSL, SL

Max Length Total (mm): 25.4

EIO Flexi-PDG for I2C, SMBus/SMLink

Description: EIO Flexi-PDG for I2C, SMBus/SMLink.

EPD_ON

EPD_ON Topology

EPD_ON Topology diagram HX12e, HX10e
EPD_ON Topology diagram H204 H404 H444 H484
EPD_ON Topology Notes
NoteDetail
R0 Ω placeholder.
R1R1 = 0 Ω for H204/H404/H444/H484 R1 = 10 kΩ ±1% for H12Xe/H10Xe
R2R2 is a placeholder and left it open or do not populate for H204/H404/H444/H484 R2 = 16.5 kΩ ±1% for H12Xe/H10Xe
Signal name/ listEPD_ON. This signal is originating from the PCH die that are required for the CPU and GPU to boot and work properly.
Routing restrictionRoute all the EPD* signals far away from the noisy source/signal. Refer to "Switching VR Circuit Guideline" chapter in PDG for the details. (Technical White Paper Doc#:  726825). Follow the small routing length as possible. Place R1 and R2 closer to GCD_IN pin (R1 and R2 are used as voltage divider to get 1.12V for H12Xe/H10Xe GCD)
Package pinsEPD_ON_CPU_OUT, EPD_ON_CPU_IN, EPD_ON_GCD_IN, EPD_ON_GCD_OUT(Previously GPP_A_15)

VDD2PWRGOOD

VDD2PWRGOOD Topology

VDD2PWRGD
VDD2PWRGOOD Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Package pinsVDD2PWRGOOD_in, VDD2PWRGOOD_out
Routing restrictionRoute the signal far away from the noisy source/signal. Follow the small routing length as possible.
Signal name/ listVDD2PWRGOOD
R0 Ω

DDR5

Description: DDR5 SODIMM

MD 1Rx16

Pcb Type & Thickness: Type-3, 0.9mm

DDR5 MD 1Rx16 DQ, DQS and RCOMP Signals Topologies
DDR5 MD 1Rx16 CA and CLK (CKD) Signals Topologies
DDR5 MD with CKD Solution
DDR5 MD Length Matching Rules
DDR5 MD 1Rx16 RESET Signals Topology
MD 1Rx16 Notes
NoteDetail
PCB stackupType-3 stackup with minimum of 10 layers.
Layer assignment rulesDDR signals are routed on layer 3, 6 and 8. Please refer to the RVP for layer assignment of memory signals.
Reference planeContinuous ground only.
Number of vias allowedMax 2 vias for DQ/ DQS; max 5 vias for CA/ CS/ CLK.
Ground stitchingFor VSS stitching using microvia, target a minimum S:G ratio of 1:1 at signal layer transition. For VSS stitching using PTH, target a minimum S:G ratio of 2:1 at signal layer transition. VSS via stitching pattern to be copied exactly from RVP / clip files.
Max MS BO/ BI lengthRefer to RFI/ EMC guidelines for the max microstrip BO/ BI length requirement.
Serpentine routingUse 3x of dielectric height for serpentine routing spacing.
Bit/ Byte swapping ruleBit swapping is allowed within each Byte for all memory technologies. DDR5: Byte Swapping is allowed within each x32 channel.
MS BO and BI segment, PTH patternKeep DDR MS BO and BI as close as possible to reference board.
CA_ODTCA/ CS/ CK ODT to be set as "Rtt" value for last DRAM and as "Open'" for all other DRAMs, by appropriate strap connection to the CA_ODT pin on DRAM. Strap connection: VSS for group A – Rtt off. VDDQ for group B – Rtt enable as per spec.
Rtt/ Ctt for RESETKeep R1 empty; R2 = 0; C1 = 0.1 uF (no stuff).
RCOMP value100 Ohm
CLK routingPlease follow the CLK with CKD routing topology and guidelines as shown in the PDG.
Max number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias Allowed
CA/CS, CLK, DQ, DQS3
RCOMP1

SODIMM 1DPC Type-3

Pcb Type & Thickness: Type-3, 0.8mm

DDR5 SODIMM Type-3 8L Signals Topologies
DDR5 SODIMM Side-by-Side Placement Block Diagram
DDR5 SODIMM Back-to-Back Placement Block Diagram
DDR5 SODIMM 1DPC Top-Pin Bottom-Pin Definition and Compensation
SODIMM 1DPC Type-3 Notes
NoteDetail
PCB stackupType-3 stackup with minimum of 8 layer.
Layer assignment rulesFollow the reference design (RVP).
Reference planeContinuous ground only.
Number of vias allowedMax 2 transition vias.
Ground stitchingFor VSS stitching using microvia, target a minimum S:G ratio of 1:1 at signal layer transition. For VSS stitching using PTH, target a minimum S:G ratio of 2:1 at signal layer transition. VSS via stitching pattern to be copied exactly from RVP / clip files.
Max MS BO/ BI lengthRefer to RFI/ EMC guidelines for the max microstrip BO/ BI length requirement.
Serpentine routingUse 3x of dielectric height for serpentine routing spacing.
Bit/ Byte swapping ruleBit swapping is allowed within each Byte for all memory technologies. DDR5: Byte Swapping is allowed within each x32 channel.
MS BO and BI segment, PTH patternKeep DDR MS BO and BI as close as possible to reference board.
DDR to Non-DDR trace spacingMinimum 500 um.
Unused signalsDDR signals on CPU which are not applicable for DDR5 can be left unconnected (example ALERT).
Rtt/ Ctt for RESETKeep R1 empty; R2 = 0 Ohm; C1 = 0.1 uF (no stuff).
RCOMP value100 Ohm
Max number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias Allowed
CA/CS, CLK, DQ, DQS2
RCOMP1

Signal Group: CA/CS, CLK, DQ, DQS

Pin group/Location: All

Channels: CH-0, CH-1, CH-2, CH-3, CH-4, CH-5, CH-6, CH-7

Segment NameCategoryStartEnd

LPDDR5/x

LPCAMM2 x128 Type-3

Pcb Type & Thickness: Type-3, 0.8mm, Type-3, 0.9mm

LPCAMM2 x128 Type-3 PCB DQ, DQS, CA, CS, CLK Topology Diagram
LPCAMM2 x128 Type-3 Reset and RCOMP Topology Diagram
LPCAMM2 x128 Type-3 CAMM Placement and Block Diagram
LPCAMM2 x128 Type-3 Notes
NoteDetail
LPCAMM2 connectorIntel recommends to follow the latest version LPCAMM2 connector CAD symbol from JEDEC Spec.
PCB stackupType-3 stackup with minimum of 8 layers.
Layer assignment rulesOuter Row DQ signals on layer3 and Inner Row DQ signals on Layer 7. CAC Signals in layer 5.
Reference planeContinuous ground only.
Number of vias allowedDQ/ RDQS/WCK CA/ CS/ CLK: Max 2 vias,
GND stitchingFor VSS stitching using microvia, target a minimum S:G ratio of 1:1 at signal layer transition. For VSS stitching using PTH, target a minimum S:G ratio of 2:1 at signal layer transition. VSS via stitching pattern to be copied exactly from RVP/ clip files.
Max MS BO/ BI lengthRefer to RFI/ EMC guidelines for the maximum microstrip BO/ BI length requirement.
Serpentine routingUse 3x of dielectric height for serpentine routing spacing.
WCK Tee-segment guidelineRoute with max differential impedance available; higher length helps reduce jitter, keep min 5 mm.
Bit/ Byte swapping ruleBit swapping is allowed within each Byte for all memory technologies. Byte swapping is allowed within a 16-bit channel. LPDDR5: x16 sub-channels can be swizzled within their x64 MC. When swapping channel DQ, the CA/CS signals must be swapped as well.
Unused signalsLeave unused DDR signals (PARITY, extra CA) floating (no connect). ALERT is also unused and can be left floating (no connect) at CPU side.
Rtt/ Ctt for RESETKeep R1 empty; R2 = 0 Ohm; C1 = 0.1 uF (no stuff).
RCOMP value100 Ohm
Max number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias Allowed
CA/CS, CLK, DQ, RDQS, WCK2
RCOMP1

Signal Group: CA/CS, CLK, DQ, RDQS, WCK

Pin group/Location: Outer

Channels: CH-0, CH-2, CH-4, CH-6

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartEnd
SoCDevice01
BO1Trace12
Via1Via23
BO2Trace34
MTrace45
BI1Trace56
Via2Via67
BI2Trace78
LPCAMM2 ConnectorDevice8-1

Pin group/Location: Inner

Channels: CH-1, CH-3, CH-5, CH-7

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartEnd
SoCDevice01
BO1Trace12
Via1Via23
BO2Trace34
BO3Trace45
MTrace56
BI1Trace67
Via2Via78
BI2Trace89

Length Matching

LPCAMM2 x128 Type-3 Length Matching
Signal GroupPlus/MinusReference GroupWithin/GroupUp to memory/connectorLength/DelayMin/Max/RangeMinMax
DQ-WCKByte (x8)Same DRAMLength (mm)Range-1214
DQ-RDQSByte (x8)Same DRAMLength (mm)Range-33
WCK-CLKChannel (x16)Same DRAMLength (mm)Range-510
DQ-DQByte (x8)Same DRAMLength (mm)Max4
CLK-CAChannel (x16)Same DRAMLength (mm)Range-55
CA-CAChannel (x16)Same DRAMLength (mm)Max7.5
CLK-CSChannel (x16)Same DRAMLength (mm)Range-12.512.5
CS-CSChannel (x16)Same DRAMLength (mm)Max10
RDQS_P-RDQS_NPair (P-N)Same DRAMLength (mm)Max0.1
WCK_P-WCK_NPair (P-N)Same DRAMLength (mm)Max0.1
CLK_P-CLK_NPair (P-N)Same DRAMLength (mm)Max0.1
CLK-CLKAll ChannelsWithin DRAMLength (mm)Max25

MD x32 Type-3

Pcb Type & Thickness: Type-3, 0.9mm

LPDDR5/x x32 Type-3 PCB DQ, DQS, CA, CS, CLK Topology Diagram
LPDDR5/x x32 Type-3 Reset and RCOMP Topology Diagram
LPDDR5_x x32 Type-3 Memory Down Placement and Block Diagram
MD x32 Type-3 Notes
NoteDetail
PCB stackupType-3 stackup with minimum of 10 layers.
Reference planeContinuous ground only.
GND stitchingFor VSS stitching using microvia, target a minimum S:G ratio of 1:1 at signal layer transition. For VSS stitching using PTH, target a minimum S:G ratio of 2:1 at signal layer transition. VSS via stitching pattern to be copied exactly from RVP/ clip files.
Max MS BO/ BI lengthRefer to RFI/ EMC guidelines for the maximum microstrip BO/ BI length requirement.
Serpentine routingUse 3x of dielectric height for serpentine routing spacing.
Bit/ Byte swapping ruleBit swapping is allowed within each Byte for all memory technologies. Byte swapping is allowed within a 16-bit channel. LPDDR5: x16 sub-channels can be swizzled within their x64 MC. When swapping channel DQ, the CA/CS signals must be swapped as well.
Unused signalsLeave unused DDR signals (PARITY, extra CA) floating (no connect). ALERT is also unused and can be left floating (no connect) at CPU side.
Rtt/ Ctt for RESETKeep R1 empty; R2 = 0 Ohm; C1 = 0.1 uF (no stuff).
RCOMP value100 Ohm
DDR to Non-DDR trace spacingMinimum 500 um.
Max number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias Allowed
CA/CS, CLK, DQ, RDQS, WCK2
RCOMP1

Pin group/Location: Outer

MD x32 Type-4

Pcb Type & Thickness: Type-4 2-x-2+, 0.8mm

LPDDR5/x x32 Type4 DQ, RDQS, WCK, CA, CS, CLK Topology Diagram
LPDDR5/x x32 Type-4 Reset and RCOMP Topology Diagram
LPDDR5_x x32 Type-4 Memory Down Placement and Block Diagram
MD x32 Type-4 Notes
NoteDetail
PCB stackupType-4 (2-x-2+) stackup with minimum of 10 layers.
Layer assignment rulesOuter row DQ on layer 2, Inner row DQ on layer 4, CAC can be on layer 6/8. Please follow RVP / Clip files for the layer assignment details.
Reference planeContinuous ground only.
Number of vias allowedDQ/ RDQS/ WCK: max 2 vias ; Only micro-vias allowed. CA/ CS/ CLK: max 2 vias; Both micro-vias & PTH allowed.
GND stitchingFor VSS stitching using microvia, target a minimum S:G ratio of 1:1 at signal layer transition. For VSS stitching using PTH, target a minimum S:G ratio of 2:1 at signal layer transition. VSS via stitching pattern to be copied exactly from RVP / Clip files.
Serpentine routingUse 3x of dielectric height for serpentine routing spacing. Do not apply serpentine routing in the break-out region.
Bit/ Byte swapping ruleBit swapping is allowed within each Byte for all memory technologies. Byte swapping is allowed within a 16-bit channel. LPDDR5: x16 sub-channels can be swizzled within their x64 MC. When swapping channel DQ, the CA/CS signals must be swapped as well.
Unused signalsLeave unused DDR signals (PARITY, extra CA) floating (no connect). ALERT is also unused and can be left floating (no connect) at CPU side.
Rtt/ Ctt for RESETKeep R1 empty; R2 = 0 Ohm; C1 = 0.1 uF (no stuff).
RCOMP value100 Ohm
DDR to Non-DDR trace spacingMinimum 500 um.
Max number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedNotes
DQ, RDQS, WCK2Only Micro Vias allowed
CA/CS, CLK42 micro via and 2 PTH
RCOMP2

Pin group/Location: Inner, Outer
